Reviews.Title: “Good stay with service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: JayemkayCanberra
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at Hotel Al Piave. I arrived having broken my foot in Florence 3 days earlier, in a cast and on crutches! From the outset the hotel staff went out of their way to help us - I really cannot speak highly enough of how wonderful they all were. I was very grateful. Now the hotel... It was relatively easy to find being an easy 5-10 minute walk from San Zecharia vaporetto stop. There was just one small bridge to cross. The rooms we had were very clean, comfortable and well appointed. (We appreciated having tea making facilities). Bathrooms were modern and fresh. (We were moved to a room with disabled bathroom after first night) The hotel is located in relatively quiet area bordering San Marco and Castello. While away from the busy tourist areas they were still in easy reach(even for me!) and there are good and well priced restaurants close by. A laundrette is located just a few stores to the right too! We enjoyed the breakfast which included eggs in addition to the usual offerings. Pastries and rolls were often still warm if you took the early breakfast option. Having stayed near Rialto on our last visit, we enjoyed the quieter ambience of the area. Service and price beat views hands down in our view. I look forward to another visit when I am walking on two legs again!

Reviews.Title: “Small is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: restaurant71
Reviews.Content: We didnâ€™t select the Al Piave. The travel agency (Hotelplan) did. Obviously, they knew what it takes to please clients. Al Piave is a true Venetian delight; warm welcome and cozy environment. You immediately feel at home in this family-run hotel. Typical Italian: â€œMamaâ€� (Mirella) at the front desk â€“ making sure everything is to your liking. â€œPapaâ€� (Paolo) running the breakfast room â€“ looking after everybody and everything. The â€œyoungstersâ€� (Illaria & Cedrico) helping you get the maximum out of your stay â€“ providing directions, giving tips on restaurants and organizing toursâ€¦ even handing out umbrellas when it rains. And the staff, too, fits well into this family atmosphere â€“ friendly, polite and always smiling. The location is ideal; right off S.Marco in the heart of Venice's historical center. Definitely a place to return. Very clean. Excellent service. And wonderful hosts. Grazie mille. Arrivederci.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: phillinda
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small hotel in a great location only 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco. Rooms are small but very carefully thought out to maximize the space. Beds are hard but comfortable. Service is top notch for a small family run hotel and breakfast is good with many choices including rolls, cereal, juice, eggs, cheese and croissants. This is a charming hotel with oldy wordly furnishing and fixtures.

Reviews.Title: “The 'perfect hotel' in Venice - just like a home to me”
Reviews.Author: sena_the_angelo
Reviews.Content: Every year I visit Venice in carnival time and I always prefer to stay in Hotel al Piave, It is just like a home to me. the staff is so friendly that I was almost in tears while I was leaving the hotel. It was also making me smile that, during the booking time, they make my life easier with the best options. Morning breakfasts are impossible to forget. Rooms are very well decorated and very comfortable and very clean. This amazing boutique hotel is very close to San Marco - five minute walking distance. I am so lucky that I have found a friendly home atmosphere in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and staff”
Reviews.Author: alibrown85
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, 5 mins from Piazza San Marco, close to plenty of good restaurants and cafes. Staff were fantastic thoughout our stay, plenty of advice given. Breakfast was good, enough to start the day. It was good value compared to other hotels in the proximity but certainly not cheap. I would stay here again and would recommend it to friends too.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: viaggeditalia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent visitors to Venice and spent 5 nights at Al Piave in September. This was our 4th stay at this family run establishment and the standard remains high. We were accomodated in a good sized room with a small terrace on the top floor of the building a few doors down the street. A much better than average breakfast is served in the hotel proper. Hosts, Paolo, Illaria and Mirella are gracious and quick to provide assistance .Rooms and bathrooms are kept spotlessly clean. The hotel is well located in Castello, close to many of the major attractions and water transportation. Venice is a joy to explore and this is best done on foot. Getting "'lost"' is half the fun of any visit to Venice and a few steps down a quiet side street is all that it takes to escape the maddening crowds.Recommended. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: beth b
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The owners were very helpful and friendly! We found it very convient that there is a laudromat only a few steps down the road. Our room was fine, we even had a little outside balcony, although it rained and we could not enjoy it. It is a short walk to St. Marks and the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good family base”
Reviews.Author: TimAus12
Reviews.Content: Family run hotel with very helpful hosts. Arranged a free water taxi to see a Murano glass factory, nice experience. Paolo and family are very helpful and friendly. We stayed in the 2 room apartment which is located a cpl doors down the street. Plenty of room for a family of four, close to amny attractions and a very Venetian experience. No views, but I don't wish to pay exhorbitant prices for such. You get your views during the day while wandering around the city anyway. A very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lwcuttx
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in November in Venice based at the Hotel Al Piave. We were really pleasantly surprised. It is in a great location just a 5 minute walk from St. Marks Square, and pretty easy to find. The rooms were nicely furnished, clean, and ours was quite roomy compared to the normal hotel room in Europe. (Not particularly sound-proof however as we had a family staying across the hall with a very loud child.) But, the staff were all very friendly and helpful which we appreciated greatly, and the breakfast, while simple, was nice and ample enough for all our wanderings. Would highly recommend it, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna I
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Italy in September. We stopped first in Venice and were pleasantly surprised with Hotel Al Piave. We had read good reviews before the trip and done our research, but this truly was a little gem in Venice. Close to everything (as long as your willing to walk to everything, be prepared to get lost, in a fun way.) The Hotel staff was excellent, family owned and run. We stayed in the apartment across the street from the main hotel. It was clean, and for Italy's standards it was quite big. Stayed 4 adults in 2 rooms with a sharing bathroom. We also offered a complimentary breakfast each morning. Although I had been hesitant about the food (I eat gluten free), Hotel Al Piave proved traveling gluten free to be an easy task. They had gluten free options for me, including GF cereal's, fresh fruit, and GF cakes. On our departing day, we were sad to go, but the staff made it a comfortable transfer out. They arranged a water taxi and helped us get our heavy bags to the waiting taxi. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jill M
Reviews.Content: We were warned that the rooms were small (which they were) but everything else was great. The location was very nice and the staff made the stay very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: N_YorksRobin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and have got to agree with the other reveiws a very good clean hotel and we got 10% discount booking direct with the hotel in advance.location is excellent 5/10 mins to St Marks or Rialto Bridge.A good breakfast was also included we did get a room on top floor (no lift) but was ok,staff very friendly and enjoyed our stay. We did find the hotel no problem just followed their instructions.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BMNS
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the Castello area and so chose this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to see how close it was to Campo Santa Maria Formosa which we visited every morning as we headed out and planned our day and usually ended up there at the end of the day just to see the "action." But back to the hotel, we were very pleased and would recommend it to others with no hesitation. No complaints, got wonderful service and had interesting chats with Claudio who was extremely helpful and charming. Al Piave was extremely clean, had comfortable beds, modern bathroom and generally was a pleasure to come back to at night. All in all one felt this place was well taken care of. BMNS, New York City

Reviews.Title: “Great value find in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: GNRMatt
Reviews.Content: When visiting Venice, there are a plethora of hotels to choose from. Some are cheap hostels that can be good for college students. Some are super expensive for the rich. If you're looking for one that is moderately priced (around $200/night), Hotel Al Piave is a top notch choice. The hotel is centrally located, making it within easy walking distance of most places in Venice. When you first arrive in Venice either by public transit boat, shuttle boat or taxi boat, you'll need to get off at the S. Zaccaria landing, which is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel provides easy walking directions from this dock on their site. The hotel itself is very clean, with a friendly staff. They even let us use the dining area when it was closed to eat lunch we brought back to the hotel. In the mornings, a free full breakfast is provided. They also provide a free shuttle service to Murano at any time that is convenient for you. While the hotel is centrally located and easily walkable from most tourist sites, it's on a quiet road so that you aren't bothered with the hustle and bustle like some of the hotels in Venice. Another positive was a great air-conditioning system, which during the summer months is definitely needed.

Reviews.Title: “High-tech in ancient style”
Reviews.Author: rigagirl43
Reviews.Content: We were actually three Latvians staying in this hotel for 3 nights, using one double room and one single room, and really enjoyed the time. Finding the hotel is not as easy as if it faced Riva degli Schiavoni or Via Garibaldi, or any large open place. It is located on a narrow street; to reach it you need to follow directions like â€œgo strait, then turn left, then immediately right, then cross a bridgeâ€¦â€� and so on. If you are in Venice for the first time, perhaps it may be a bit confusing but not much. Having reached Rugga Giuffa, look for the lantern-shaped sign â€œAl Piaveâ€� sticking out from the building. I had a single room and was first disappointed when the bathroom was across the corridor, although it was not shared with any other room. Perhaps this had something to do with the building's layout - not everything is possible. But then it was ok when I found a large bathing-robe on the bed. Premises are well-equipped; bathroom was perfect, with a hair dryer and a shower niche which is generally better than a separate cabin. The room was arranged in the traditional, ancient style with a comfy bed; the only disturbance was some noisy parties during the first night. Breakfast was also pretty good, especially fruits and excellent juicy plums. I didnâ€™t like coffee which seemed to be instant coffee, but cappuccino was much better. Spongy white bread was so-so, especially if you are from a country where black and wholegrain bread is preferred. Staff was also kind and very helpful, we as art historians already knew where to find our objects of interest, but I heard them carefully explaining to other guests which are the churches housing those famous Titians and Tintorettos.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, tight room”
Reviews.Author: DCDave11
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was good, great location to see Venice. The hotel has a main lobby where breakfast is served (which was very good), but the rooms are old apartments nearby. There was some construction going on at the time, so there was some noise in the morning/during the day. The room we stayed in was on the top floor, and had a very low ceiling and a restricted bathroom. If you are tall or bulky, email ahead and ask if you will have issues. The staff was very helpful. Look up on a map how to get there from the water, the directions are good but some prep work would have made it easier.

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly elegant and quiet”
Reviews.Author: vivace_8
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Tripadvisor reviewers for your comments about Hotel Al Piave - we chose this hotel for our first visit to Venice and we were very happy. Very friendly staff, very helpful. For the price Hotel Al Piave is elegant and a great deal. The fragrance of the fresh flowers at the front desk is a lovely touch. Our room # 17 was spacious and the bathroom very fresh and roomy. The beds were wonderfully comfortable and the room very quiet. The hotel is located very close to San Marco Basilica and the vaporetta (sp?) system which is a big plus. The breakfast room and breakfast offerings were very satisfying and one time we got to sit outside in the "patio" area and ate our breakfast watching locals and tourists passing by. Returning to Hotel Al Piave every evening was an adventure in itself and on entering the warm and welcoming reception area I always felt like it was just the finest way to finish a day of discovering Venice. I highly recommend Hotel Al Piave. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mickirish
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel al Piave twice in the past four months: once in a double room with my 79 year old mother, and most recently in a triple room with husband and teenage son. The location is very convenient to St Mark's Square and also to the Rialto Bridge. Although Venice is very small and walkable, hotel location is very important because of the lack of free public toilets. The location of the Hotel al Piave made it easy to circle back for a bathroom break when necessary. The front desk, particularly the tall blond woman (whose name I have unfortunately forgotten) is extremely helpful, speaks perfect English, but is also very patient with you if you want to try out your Italian. She went out of her way to map out shortcuts through the city, including a way to take the vaporetto to Burano that cut 1/2 hour off the traveling time each way. The breakfast selections are varied and plentiful. Scrambled eggs are available upon request. The breakfast room is bright and cheerful, with Venetian glass light fixtures and Burano lace tablecloths, and displays of Venetian glass. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but the walls are thin. The double-paned windows do a good job of blocking out any outside noise, so most of the noise comes from other guests who talk as they walk through the corridor or fumble with their room key. During our August stay, the air conditioning was sufficient to create white noise to block out any outside sound. The price is extremely reasonable for Venice. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Charming in a Graet location”
Reviews.Author: mandm070359
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Al Piave for 5 nights. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. Claudio at the front desk answered any questions we had. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and when we arrived in our room there was a lovely bottle of prosecco on ice with 2 flutes. Such a nice gesture!! We stayed in room 105 which had a little terrace. I agree with other reviews the walls are quite thin. We turned our air conditioner on to have some white noise to block out some of the sounds, however, over all it was quite quiet. The only downfall to the room was that as the buildings are all so very close to one another when the neighbours turned their light on in their home at 11:30 p.m. it lit up our room - we were able to remedy that by closing the blinds on the window and putting the bedspread over the door to block the light so that it would not wake us. The breakfast was perfect - eggs, croissants, meats, cheeses, fresh fruit salad and yogurt were available every day. The location was perfect just a 7 minute walk to St. Marks Square. Close to many restaurants and shops. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. The price was right too!! I would not bother paying for a more expensive hotel - we were only ever in our rooms to sleep. A three star hotel is more than adequate!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: mart031
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about this San Marco hotel. The cost is lower than most hotels nearby. The room was adequate, but quite small. It was Ok. The breakfast was good. The only negative thing was the drunk Americans arguing during the night at the top of their voices, but that isnt really the fault of the hotel. Would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Ricqui J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived around sunset so as we were walking to the hotel it started to get dark. Venice streets are confusing they are like a maze but this hotel is not far from where the airport bus let's you off. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and spacious. We had a full kitchen in our "wardrobe." At first I though it was extra storage but when we opened it we found a sink, a stove and a refrigerator. There were pots, pans, dishes and silverware. It worked out perfectly being that we took some food home from dinner. The staff were also helpful in giving directions and recommendations for places to eat. Very short walk to St. Mark's Square and the Rialta Bridge (spelling). The breakfast consisted of deli meats, cheese, croissants, cereal, juice, water and coffee/cappuccino on request. The only complaint I would have if any is our room was on the first floor and there was a alley way in between our room and the front desk so we could hear people passing by, talking, etc. I would definitely stay here again. The price was not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly comfortable hotel in located near to attractions and transport”
Reviews.Author: kdww
Reviews.Content: A really enjoyable stay at the hotel al Piave. Very friendly and helpful staff and a great breakfast. The room was small but very comfortable and clean. Highly recommended and would look forward to staying again.Â  Free wifi access was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Front Desk and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jonnystaines
Reviews.Content: About 5 minutes walk from the airport boat and 5 minutes from St Marks Square this hotel exceeded my expectations. It had airconditioning (a must in humid Venice), a better than average breakfast and excellent front desk. The chap at front was very helpful and has a very good manner. The only negative is a lack of lift which (through my lack of forethought) meant a 2 storey walk for my mother. We moved to the 1st floor (much better) for the last 2 nights of our stay which was much easier to get to. Rooms small but to be expected in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for Venice”
Reviews.Author: visitingfromnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 116 for 3 nights in Sept 2011. Hotel was a little tricky to find, especially after being tired from a long flight, but once inside, everyone was welcoming and friendly. The hotel is very convenient to St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Several restaurants are nearby. Room was smallish but adequate and clean. It contained a bed, desk and large wardrobe. Bathroom was bright, clean and good sized. The windows were thick and blocked out all of the street noise. We could hear a little noise from within the room, but nothing that disturbed our sleep (and my husband is a very light sleeper). Breakfast included nicely cooked scrambled eggs, meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit and bread. Coffee/cappuccino was excellent. Hotel offered free wi-fi, which we could pick up from our room without a problem. Considering prices of other hotels I looked at in Venice, this was a bargain. I would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family-run hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler922
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the room across the street from the hotel and it was lovely. The owners were friendly and helpful, including giving us a street map to be sure we didn't get lost (it's easy to in Venice). And when we realized a few days after checking out that we'd left valuables behind, the owners didn't hesitate - they located the item and helped us ship it home. They helped make it a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a really convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pea18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. Our room was small but served its purpose - we were never in there! Venice is an amazing place, with too much to explore to sit in a hotel room. Breakfast was great - make sure you ask for a Cappuccino instead of a regular coffee - yum! If you're looking for a hotel that's close to all the action at a reasonable price - this is it. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Simon M
Reviews.Content: A really nice small hotel right in the middle of venice. The check in was fast and we got the room we wanted on the ground floor (I asked for a ground room when booked). The room was very small but it had a stove (lol....i dont know what for). Bathroom was big enough but little bit of a weird layout. The breakfast was pretty good with scrambled eggs, croissants, buns, cold cuts, etc. Overall it was a good hotel and if we ever come back to Venice I wouldn't mind staying there again, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: imolakadar
Reviews.Content: We have spent here a 4 nights holiday. There was a special offer in that periode what we have found on the hotel webside directly ( in was not included in bookings.com ) , paying for only 3 nights and staying 4, so the rates were also OK ( considering it is Venice ...). Location is perfect, close to all the main attractions and to the vaporetto , staff is very friendly and hepful , breakfeast is good, rooms are clean. So, I recommend it to all. Only downside is the size of the rooms, which is ok for 2, but do not recommend it for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy retreat in Venice, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: mbergt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in May 2011. Being our first time to Venice, we were nervous about finding the hotel in the maze of streets. Luckily, the detailed directions that accompanied our reservation led us directly to the hotel. The man at checkin (cannot remember name) was extremely pleasant and helpful. He gave us all sorts of info about activities and transportation options, as well as detailed info about the hotel itself such as breafast times. The breakfast was wonderful, hot coffee and a great spread of pastries, fruit and cheeses. What a great way to start a day of exploring in beautiful Venice! The room was very adaquate with a nice bathroom, TV and air conditioning. It even had a hidden safe in the closet and a desk for writing post cards and relaxing. The only complaint is that the hotel has very thin walls - you can hear everything that is going on in the hallway and adjacent rooms. This was only a minor issue for us because the other aspects of the hotel make up for it. Overall, this is a fantastic family run hotel with great charm and an even better value in the overpriced city of Venice. We will be staying here again in the future, thanks Al Piave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great People, We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the handicap-access room (although none of us are handicapped), which may skew our review. That said, our room was beautiful and spacious and very modern! The bathroom was huge and very modern. You may need some instructions for some of the gizmos (we accidentally turned off the cold water for the building...whoops). The folks at the front desk are very nice and helpful although constantly busy. The breakfast is delicious, and there were even some freshly cooked eggs, which is a real treat in Europe. You can pay 1 euro/ 15 minute for internet access at their computer. I really liked the location because it was a quieter area. It was near one of the smaller piazzas, which meant we could find food and nice places to walk without getting caught in flocks of other tourists. Once you know your way around, its only a pleasant 5-10 minute walk to the Rialto bridge or San Marco square. We had only one complaint: when we arrived at 7am on the first day, they kindly offered us breakfast but didn't tell us they would charge us for the extra meal until we were checking out 2 days later. I wasn't too surprised and we probably would have eaten the meal anyway, but it seemed misleading and unprofessional by not mentioning the cost. Otherwise, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FioriChild
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel in the heart of Venice. They comfortably accommodated our families with children traveling together. Breakfast each morning was a plus. Rooms and bathrooms were well appointed, modern and very clean. Cleanliness is most important to me. The staff was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family suite across the street and my parents stayed in one of the rooms in the main hotel. The rooms were plain, but clean, comfortable, and quiet. The owners were extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The breakfast was excellent and the location was perfect. The price was also very reasonable. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 3 star hotel in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerInNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family suite - 2 rooms and 1 bath. Perfect for familes. Great location - walking distance to everything in Venice. Decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay. Highly reccomend it”
Reviews.Author: HAmlani
Reviews.Content: The hosts made us feel very comfortable and the service from all the staff was excellent. The rooms were comfortable. The breakfast was very good with eggs to order and the most fantastic cappuccino. A caution that they do not have elevators and we were on the fourth floor of a pension style building. Although they did say that they will have their elevators working on September. Very good restaurants and shops close by and you are literally minutes away from San Marks Sq and Rialto Bridge..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place! Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: VQC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights in early June 2011. Wonderful suite for parents and 16 year old son. Location is just close enough to St. Mark's, but just far enough. Accomondations are fantastic! Good restuarants not far away! Extra plus: laundromat just 200 feet away! Very nice! Be sure to plug in wall/outlet bug off. Throughout Itally, there are no screens and this is necessary in the evening. Don't let this keep you away! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cheap-traveler28
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Venice----day of this post was the last. Hotel service was first class. Manager (owner?) was extremely nice. Location is behind St Marks square, so the price is actually of good value. Air conditioning was the best we have experience in Italy (yes, I am a spoiled American;). Hotel has 27 air-conditioned rooms with a safe and fridge. Also has free large breakfast which saves a lot of money in Venice. I would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nice location. Service made this a very good place.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAllCreation
Reviews.Content: Highlights follow below for quick review: Plusses: 1] Service of staff was very good. When we arrived on Friday morning, we were given choice of 3 rooms, and got to see each of the three to pick the one we liked most. We selected one on the top floor because it had a nice balcony from which to soak up the atmosphere (note that the balcony did not really have a view but was Italianesque and nice to enjoy a drink on after a day exploring Venice). One point to make here is that there is no elevator, so if stairs wear you out, select a lower floor. However, the staff carried our luggage up and down the stairs when we arrived and departed. 2] Nice breakfast each morning, with broad selection of items. 3] Really convenient location; only about a 5 minute walk to San Marco Piazza, and about a 10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge. Several nice restaurants nearby. 4] Very good value for Venice in what was still the shoulder of the high season. Negatives: 1] No real drawbacks but I will identify a couple items to keep in mind as you consider the best place for you to book your stay. 2] First, this is not a 'luxury' hotel so if you want to be pampered and expect fancy, this is not your place. It is a comfortable room, but not high end. This should go without saying based on the price, but want to emphasize. 3] If you book through a 3rd party (e.g. hotels.com), you will not have choice of room and may be placed in 'sister' hotel, which happened to the couple checking in before us. They were not happy about it and got pretty loud. Best to book direct if you want to know you will be at this hotel property. Overall, we really liked this place because it was such a good value and we were treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time”
Reviews.Author: mrcarlisle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2007, and returned July 20 and 21 of 2011. Still a great family run hotel. They can't do enough for their guest, after 2 nights we had to move as they were booked. The son in the family took our luggage and led us to our new hotel. We plan to return in April 2012

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LL_tourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 years ago with mom; came back for my honeymoon!!!!! The hotel is charming, rooms are decent and breakfast is every morning. Hotel staff is excellent and very helpful. I've only seen one room at this hotel -- I believe it's a double superior and it's on the 4th floor with a private terrace that is just charming!!!! Pay a little more for this room. It's simply fabulous. **It's a 4-story walk-up so careful with luggage! Also - hotel surprised us with a bottle of complimentary champagne for our honeymoon celebrations!!!! I will stay at Hotel Al Piave when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LorenzoBerkeley
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortunate to be upgraded to a larger room, since we were spending six nights here. Very charming and tasteful room. Nice breakfast room. Eggs served on request. Staff very helpful, especially Claudio at front desk. Quiet. Bed was comfortable. Very clean. Only public laundromat in Venice is about one block away. Close to San Marco, yet a bit off the tourist path.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: luckywin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Al Piave for the 4th time in April 2011 for the 4th time. I can truly say that this hidden Venetian gem's stay was better than ever. The Hotel is beautifully kept, spotlessly cleaned, and the breakfast is the best I have ever had anywhere in Europe. The owners and staff genuinly care for there clientell. I hope my next trip to venice is soon so we can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room -- great breakfast -- highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: OtherMountainDude
Reviews.Content: We had the top floor room in the annex across the street. It had a private terrace, and since it was several floors above street level, the room was extremely quiet. When you combine that with a a very efficient air conditioning unit, you have an excellent place to retreat from the heat and the crowds during the afternoon. The room was completely clean and the bathroom was modern. The wi-fi worked great. The breakfast was the best we've encountered in Italy -- by far. They have all the breads and pastries you usually find, but they also have meat and hot scrambled eggs. You leave the table feeling like you've actually had a real meal. They present it very attractively and keep it replenished during their breakfast hours. The staff -- from the managers to the housekeepers -- seem like very nice, friendly people. This was our second trip to this hotel. Both of our experiences there have been extremely positive. When we make our next trip to Venice, this hotel will be our base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: EltonandAnn
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first stop in our 2 week tour of Italy. We arrived at midnight and found our way to the hotel. The room was tiny but this is standard for any hotel in Venice. It was relatively expensive compared to the other hotels we stayed in Italy however this is again because of Venice. What I can definelty say is that the service was excellent and the location was perfect! 5 mins away from the Rialto bridge and about 7 mins away from San Marco square, could not have planned for anything better in terms of location. If you are in Venice for a short stay, i.e 1 or 2 days, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Hotel Al Piave!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoverACG
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! Our room and bathroom were both very small, but cozy. The AC worked great compared to other hotels in Italy. The location was convenient and having someone at the desk 24/7 was nice. Claudio was especially wonderful and extremely helpful!!! The breakfast was really good. They will make you a cappuccino upon request and even serve eggs if desired. Great hotel and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Typical European Hotel Room With No View”
Reviews.Author: bsharynu
Reviews.Content: Had a double room and it was a typical European room. Bathroom was small but average and had a sink, shower, toilet, and bidet. The view was terrible. It was of a small street that had wripped flyers on the walls. There were no darkening shades in the room, so it was always light in the room, even in the middle of the night. From St. Mark's Square, the location is a 5 minute walk (if you can find it). We got lost everytime we tried to find the hotel. We wanted to check out a day early and the owners didn't want to let us. Our only saviour was that we booked through booking.com and not directly through the hotel. The owners told us we were lucky that we booked through booking.com and not through them, because they would have made us pay for our planned 3 nights and not just 2. (The fact that the owners said that to us put a bad taste in our mouth. Why would she say that?) The breakfast was the only plus side. It was good and plentiful, and they made cappucinos, macchiatos, etc. to order. The downside is that it is the same breakfast each day. Not a big deal for us only there for 2 nights, but it might be an issue if you stay for a week. Reflecting back, I would have preferred to pay $50 more per night and get a hotel on a canal with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up for Hotel Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: TexInMadrid
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at Hotel Al Piave, April 21-24 2011. I was extremely pleased from Check-In until Check-Out. The staff at the front desk and at the Breakfast Bar were extremely friendly. I really appreciated the fact that they notifiied me upon check-in that I would have to move on my last night. There were so many positve things at the hotel that outweighed the inconvenience of having to move rooms. Their Breakfast Bar was a big PLUS and a great way to get started. Breakfast was very complete with plenty of options to choose from. Wireless internet access was another PLUS. When I mentioned that I needed an electric adapter for my PC, the front desk clerk quickly offered an adapter for me to use. I would return to Al Piave anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: honeybee313
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Piave for 2 nights. It is rather difficult to find, so bring an excellent map. Also, Google maps shows the wrong location for this hotel so do not plan on relying on the Google maps location as we did! The location is excellent, as it is close to St. Mark's square but far enough away that it is quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and spoke excellent English. Breakfast was very good. There was a good selection of pastries, yogurt, cheeses and meats. Upon request they would make eggs as well. I don't think there is a lift but the hotel staff carried our bags to our rooms when we checked in. The bed was comfortable. My only complaint about the room is that there was only one electrical outlet in the entire room which made it hard for us to charge our electronics. The room was a bit expensive compared to our other hotels in Italy, but I believe it is a good value for Venice. They have free wireless internet, which was nice. I would recommend taking the vaporetto to San Marco instead of walking from the train station as we did because it is so easy to get lost in Venice! I would definitely stay at Hotel Al Piave again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice, rooms are cramped but clean”
Reviews.Author: Mayday44
Reviews.Content: To start with, Venice hotels are old, small and a bit quirky. They are generally rehabbed old homes, etc. so you are not going to find big, modern hotels like most Americans are used to. Also, hotels are expensive here so I really had to do some digging to find a decent value. I would actually say this hotel was probably "very good" by Venice standards but just average by most hotel standards. This was definitely one of the more budget friendly hotels I could find but it was by no means inexpensive. The room was small with old decor and the bed could have been more comfortable. However, the bathroom was a decent size and very clean. The breakfast room was average though the staff was pretty helpful and friendly. They made dinner reservations for us and gave suggestions of things to see and do as well. The hotel is challenging to find but that is pretty much the case for everything in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little gem”
Reviews.Author: tpaz
Reviews.Content: Great little gem. Friendly, helpful staff. Good location between Piazza San Marco (St. Marks Square) and Ponte di Rialto (Rialto Bridge).

Reviews.Title: “A good option in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ZuzuTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on a recommendation from a tour book. Our room was small, but clean and very comfortable. The staff was very polite, and allowed us to use the internet for free as long as we were brief. Otherwise, it is 1 euro for internet use. The hotel is easy to get to, for Venice. It is about a five minute walk from the airport boat landings. The roads are cobbled and not easy to pull luggage on, but all of Venice is like that, so that can't be helped. This hotel is about five minutes from Saint Mark's and the main square, but that is a good thing: the walk is easy, and the area is quieter than the area around the touristy areas. If you are going to Venice for the first time, realize that it is not a large place, and you can get almost anywhere in just a few minutes. You can save a lot of money with that knowledge. All in all, we liked the hotel, but it was a bit expensive. Then again, all of the places we looked at were more expensive, because Venice is an expensive city. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tgfield
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location. It is near St Mark's, and in a nice central spot (although everywhere in venice is a pretty quick walk as long as you don't get lost). Also is very close to water taxi stop and any easy straight path to get to water bus stop. The rooms are small (as we expected) but everything is clean and efficient. The staff was also nice and helpful, particularly Claudio. TIP FOR GONDOLA RIDES: Al Piave has an arrangement with a spot right near the hotel for a set price of 80 euro. Saves you from haggling with them, and from what we understand they usually try to charge you more and rarely will they accept under 80. We inquired about gondola rides and Claudio gave us a card to present to the gondolier. Make sure your windows are closed at night, mosquitos are bad in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Sounds Great - wish I had been in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeaCoug
Reviews.Content: Reading all these reviews, I hate to write a negative one but since I didn't get to stay in the actual hotel, I felt obligated to warn other travelers. We booked 2 nights at this hotel and we arrived we were told that we were staying in rooms that were a few streets away. Apparently they had some "apartments" that were part of the hotel. The room was clean, but 1) the tv only had 1 channel, the remote didn't work, there was no phone that worked to the hotel, the remote for the heat didn't work so we were being roasted out the room, had to get dressed and walk back to the hotel and ask for it be turned off...unforunately, by the time we got back, it was the night clerk, and they did not know how to turn it off, so after a bunch of investigating, i figured out how to turn it off manually. The room was on a side street and was dark, it required several combinations of keys to get in, one for the outside door and one for the room. The other room was upstairs so you got enjoy the other people above tramping around until they went to bed. The staff were really nice and the breakfast was great and I am sure the hotel was nice but since we didn't stay there..... Just make sure when you book that you don't get one of the apartments.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: moshiface
Reviews.Content: an amazing gem of a hotel located right next to piazza san marco. everything in this hotel is perfect, done to the highest standard and makes for a much more relaxing stay in venice. the staff are very helpful and friendly, particularly a gentleman at the reception called claudius i think his name was.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: camires731
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through the reviews of trip advisor. Great choice. We opted for room 115 with an outdoor terrace, perfect addition! We walked in the room pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and the bathroom, in addition the sparkling wine waiting for us due to our honeymoon. The room was a wonderful quiet oasis from the crowded tourist areas that is Venice. We were budget travelers, hoping to live off of $200 us dollars a day, and did it. Our best meal was at Osteria Trattoria Al N something north of the rialto bridge. My biggest regret, not ordering cuttlefish while there. I assumed I'd see it at other restaurants throughout our other destinations (Siena and Cinque Terre) and never saw it again :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Mauilover_9
Reviews.Content: The Al Piave is a perfect little hotel. When we arrived we were warmly welcomed by Claudio. Claudio and the rest of the staff were fantastic. A lot of people comment on the breakfast, I thought it was more than adequate. The scrambled eggs were very good every day. Only on the last day were they watery as some people have said. The breakfast staff were great, wish I could remember their names. The location is perfect with many good restaurants nearby. They only drawback was the tiny shower, but this is a problem anywhere in Italy. Don't know how the Italians do it as most of them are a lot bigger than me. My 6'2" son found it a challenge. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will return for sure. We found Venice to be absolutely lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: asiancorner
Reviews.Content: Around mid July my family and I were roaming Venice little streets from very early in the morning, then went to Murano and back again later in the evening. We were exhausted and kept looking for a place to spend the night in Venice, until we came across Al Piave hotel by coinicidence. We received a warm welcome by Claudio who got us 2 rooms and fantastic rates- given that it was peak tourist period- . The rooms were spacious, clean and cozy...great value. Next morning we had a rich breakfast and again very friendly service all included in the BB rate. To top it all before checking out we met the owners and we chatted for almost 30 min. They turned out to be extremely friendly and helpful. I have been travelling extensively for the past 20 years and I personally consider Al Piave one of my best hotel experiences

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: NYRoadtripper
Reviews.Content: Great location for a Venice visit, close enough to the central action. Gracious, friendly and helpful staff. The room we had exceeded my expectations for a hotel of this price and star category...modern bathroom, air conditioning and one of the few hotels I've had in Italy with free wireless internet access as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room, Breakfast, Helpful and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: EfficiencyGeek
Reviews.Content: The review title summarizes, but some details: 5 min walk to St Mark's square and about 7 mins to Rialto (if you don't get lost in Venice as it is such a maze :-)). The room was very ornate, spacious, bathroom was clean, shower had good pressure, full bodied pillows. The shower tub was somewhat tight but seems to be common in Italy. Minor annoyance was the thermostat which could only start/stop the ac, but not change the temperature. The breakfast included egg cooked to your liking, and coffee or hot chocolate served to you. The staff was friendly, one guy even helped load the prepaid cell credits into my WIND/TIM cell SIM, as the instructions were all italian. Talk about customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Fantastic location - Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bunnylicious
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Piave for 3 nights and were not disappointed! On our arrival we were greeted by Claudio - who was very polite and helpful throughout our stay (To be honest, all of the staff were friendly and helpful, but Claudio even helped to confirm our booking at The Venice Jazz Club and give us good advice regarding places to eat). We stayed in a double room (although technically a twin) on the first floor. Our room was equipped with air conditioning, ensuite bathroom (shower, toilet, basin & bidet) and a wardrobe at the far end of the bedroom which contained coffee making facilities, a kitchen sink and hob!! A continental buffet breakfast was inclusive in our stay (selection of cereals, fruits, yoghurts, hams & cheeses, croissants/pastries and scrambled eggs) - and a rather good cappucino!! The location of Al Piave really is fantastic! It is great for walking everywhere but also a short walk from one of the many canals for water taxis (should you require one). It certainly is a bonus when you are walking round in 40 degrees of heat and have the option to nip back to the hotel for a quick shower/change of clothes or a little midday siesta. Ruga Giuffa itself has a few restaurants and shops along it and is busy enough to be able to find it relatively easily - but quiet enough to be able to get some sleep (located centrally but not on a major tourist route). We booked directly via the hotel website and recieved a 20% discount for staying 3 nights - but saw that they do a few other offers too. Overall, the hotel was clean, comfy, and quiet with a great location. We will definitely return on future visits! Thank you Al Piave!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and perfect for anniversary”
Reviews.Author: cleo43
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay for our anniversary / belated honeymoon. Very friendly staff. They surprised us with champagne in the room. Also they helped husband's sister (back in US) send us a beautiful bouquet of flowers. They were very patient and diligent answering our many questions regarding the different aspects of our trip (confusing opening hours on a place we wanted to visit, entertainment, transportation, and directions for example). Great breakfast - fruit, eggs, meats, cheeses, pastries, yogurt. Great location - easy to get to both San Marco and Fondamente Nove Vaporretto / Alilaguna stops. Fte. Nove is much shorter ride from airport with only 1 tricky turn while walking. They have a variety of room types - we really liked having the balcony / patio on our room. Internet computer was easy to use with minimal charge. Liked Best: Location, staff Liked Least: can't think of anything I would change

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff, Fairly Basic”
Reviews.Author: kleic
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and two teenagers stayed here for three nights at the beginning of our 15-day trip to Italy last month. It's a convenient and very welcoming place to stay but fairly basic. We had a quad, which consisted of a bathroom and two bedrooms, and it worked well for our family. The hotel is an 8-minute walk from San Marco, on a street with decent family restaurants, shops, and a great laundromat, and the cappachino at breakfast was awesome. No elegance or particularly fancy facilities but definitely a great base for our family's exploration of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great eggs!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovepeachs
Reviews.Content: We or I should say I splurged (my Dad was sure he could find the way and he probably could have) and paid the cart boy at the boat to take our luggage and us to the hotel and I thought it was worth the 35 E after a long day of traveling. The hotel is not far from anything and you can easily get there with your luggage in tow. The hotel was perfect location and very nice. The breakfast was one of the best we had while in italy with the luxury of scrambled eggs! The only place they had them while in Italy. There is a laundromat just a few stores down too. A little complicated to figure out but luckily I was there when some other Americans were there and they had figured it out already. it was really nice to talk with other Americans ( A few more came in after me. One was a Dad whose daughter had fallen in the canal and we had seen it, pretty funny!)) There was some confusion when we arrived and we ended up with a room with a single bed and a room with a "Queen" and a child bed-(skinny twin). We had wanted two rooms both doubles. The first night my Mom had to sleep in our room but then they moved my parents into a very nice dbl room. So it all worked out. We loved Venice. Took a tour of the grand canal, very informative and took the elevator to the the top of the bell tower...cool but bummer if you happen to be up there when the bells go off! The high light was the visit to the glass factory which was free. We were lucky enough to see one of the artist etching gold /glass tiles. He was incredible as was our guide. The history behind the tile he was doing was fascinating and the artist was so nice and talented. another funny thing that happened while we were there was seeing a singer on one of the gondolas fall into the canal! He was getting really into the song and almost fell all the way in! He must have taken it in good stride because he was smiling and singing something in Italian that was making all the Italians laugh afterwards!

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 star hotel in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: pjpug
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for charm & location my daughter and I loved this hotel. We were two women traveling in Rome, Florence and Venice, and this was our favorite hotel. I have visited Venice twice before with my husband and stayed in 4 & 5 star hotels. Friends we met there were in a 4 star right on the water near San Marco where they could see all the people and boats arriving. I liked our experience better. Walking through some narrow paths on the way to the hotel and coming upon an ancient church or an unexpected piazza filled with wonderful restaurants and activity is part of the hotels charm. You arrive by water bus near St. Mark's square and once you're at the hotel, if you venture in the opposite direction as you leave (have a good map) you'll wind up at the Rialto Bridge (about 10 min. walk). The people at the desk were always accommodating and helpful. The breakfast was lovely and plentiful. You can see the care they take in the table setting with beautiful linens and china. The rooms were very clean and had the best bathroom of all four hotels we stayed in while in Italy (showers can be quite small we noticed). We stayed on the second floor so we had our own balcony with flowers and this made for great pictures. We like being upstairs because Italy doesn't have screens on windows and we like to have fresh air at night and be safe. And no, I'm not related to the owners. This is the only hotel review I'm doing. They deserve recognition.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly hotel, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: dph3jc
Reviews.Content: Incredibly friendly hotel in a really central location at a great price (for Venice!). Lovely, ornate room which was very comfortable and Claudio (in particular) could not have been more helpful. Breakfasts were very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripchick2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Clean, comfortable, very helpful and friendly staff. It also had the best breakfast we had on our two-week trip to Europe. It's small but all of the space is well-used. Charming.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: CAOrsini
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was wonderful. My husband and I were looking for a CLEAN reasonably priced room, and we found so much more. Literally five minutes from St Mark's square this little gem is a lovely family owned hotel. Take the time to get to know the owners and staff. You will be rewarded with their wealth of nontouristy places to see while you're there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a small Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: FV265
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Al Piave was recommended in a travel guide. It is a bit hard to find the first time as it is located several blocks away from the St. Marks water bus dropoff, but it is worth the walk and once located, it is actually pretty convenient to St. Marks, the Rialto Bridge area, and shopping/dining areas. The area around the hotel is very quiet at night which made for undisturbed sleep. The staff of the hotel are very friendly and spoke fluent English. Our "double superior" room was larger than I had expected and comfortable. There is not real view of anything from the room windows as it is squeezed between nearby buildings. There are more luxurious hotels in Venice but the Al Piave was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel, Comfortable Rooms and well located!!”
Reviews.Author: SavageMark
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reading many reviews from Trip Advisor. They were right! This hotel is well located, walking distance to St. Mark's square. It was a little tricky to find but their website map is pretty good. We followed all their instructions and found the hotel no problem. The rooms are comfortable, roomy and clean. The bathroom was superclean and the towels white and fluffy! The staff was super friendly, especially to our son (18 month-old baby). It was refreshing to come back after a long day of touring to our rooms and felt at home. The breakfast was really good, cappuccinos, eggs, etc. Each one of the staff was very attentive and courteous. We will love to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: cruiseboy252
Reviews.Content: We were part of a Rick Steve's tour group (FANTASTIC way to tour Europe!), so we didn't have a choice in which hotels we would be staying in, but they wouldn't book us into a bad place. And this was NOT a bad place. The location was perfect! Some much to do and see just steps outside the front door. St. Marks Square was a little distance away, but Venice is such a great city to walk (or take a gondola) in. The front desk staff is very eager to please. Many of them speak very good English, but it's fun, and appreciated by them, if you at least try to speak Italian, even if you butcher everything you're trying to say. The lobby is very inviting to just sit and relax in for a little bit. There are no elevators, so whatever luggage you have, you have to carry it upstairs. I don't know if they offer assistance with luggage, my wife and I had just two fairly small backpacks each, so this was not a problem. The room was clean and mostly comfortable. I thought the bed was a little hard, so I didn't sleep all that well. But, I don't think that's a knock on the hotel. It was nice to hear church bells (not close enough to be too loud) in the early evening and the morning. It added a lot to the whole experience. The bathroom was spotless and looked like it had been updated fairly recently. Lots of hot water. With the exception of the bed, I wouldn't hesitate for one second to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: megagal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a nice stay at this Hotel Al Piave during Carnivale 2010. We rented a family suite for a couple with two boys, 10 and 15. There was adequate space and the rooms were spotless. TVs, irons, hair dryers made them well equipped. The hotel is not luxurious but gives yo more than you would expect for the reasonable rates. Maid service was prompt and effective. Location is superb with a short walk to St. Marks, Rialto, gondeliers and vaporetto... Breakfast was more than servicable. Great coffee, expresso and hearthy with fresh eggs. The Puppin family are welcoming and informative. One piece of advice-splurge on the water taxi to and from the airport. The dropoff is minutes from the hotel. Walking from the vaporetto stop up and down stairs with luggage was a BIG MISTAKE for us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonable lodging”
Reviews.Author: blknight113
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Al Piave through Travelocity Incentives, as we had some gift certificates to use. We had never been to Venice, and finding the right hotel in our price range was definately a challenge! We looked at our choices, then came to tripadvisor to check the reviews to help us with our decision. We were not disappointed with the Al Piave. The room, although somewhat small, was clean and well appointed with a little fridge, a tv, a safe and a newly remodeled private bathroom. We had a street-facing window, which made it a little noisy when open, but the new double paned windows blocked it out nicely when closed. There is a guest computer under the stairs, which you pay for by the minute at the front desk. The breakfast was nice, the normal continental fare plus some scrambled eggs if you're tired of bread, cheese and meat. The front desk is very helpful and they speak fluent english. They will store your luggage for you if you have a later departure scheduled.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel al Piave is our home away from home whenever we're in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: ShellyPCat
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay with Hotel al Piave and as always we only wish we'd had more time there. The difference this time was that we had our friend along with us and therefore needed a larger accomodation. She and I were also running in the Venice marathon so we required a kitchen in order to prepare that early morning brekkie. We booked the one bedroom studio apartment (Blue Studio). When I arrived to check in, I was informed that they had given us a different apartment. It was so much larger than the one I'd booked. I couldn't be happier. This apartment was over 3 floors and had a full kitchen, living room, large bathroom, ample queen bedroom, and a cute single on the top floor. The apartment is located right accross the alley from a pasticceria and the smell is divine. The staff of Al Piave were, as always, willing to go the extra mile. We love it there and have sent 2 other groups of people there over the years also, and they loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quiet place to stay with children”
Reviews.Author: Belganna
Reviews.Content: the hotel is central and easy to find. the staff is very friendly and helpful and we felt very welcome also with our children. though we had an appartment-unit with our own kitchen, we enjoyed the very good breakfast in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: traceyperth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, small room although quiet and very clean, nice breakfast and convenient location. Friendly staff but we had heard there were far better priced hotels/apartments in Venice. No lift can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for a 3-star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: littlegreen1017
Reviews.Content: It's a 3-star hotel with fairly old decoration, but the service is excellent! The staff were helpful and friendly, we were surprise to get this wonderful service in Italy. The room was small, but the hotel was in a great location. It's a bit difficult to find at the beginning, then we found out it's located in pretty central location~easy walk to most of the major site. The breakfast was good, they got everything you need. The only bad thing is this tiny hotel doesn't have an elevator, pretty difficult to carry the luggage up and down at the narrow staircase. The friendly service will make you feel like home!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: viaggeditalia
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Al Piave. As previously our experience was most satisfactory. We were accomodated for 5 nights in the appartment a short walk down Ruga Guiffa which offers a spacious living room with kitchenette and large bedroom and bathroom upstairs. Staff are friendly and accomodating and most have VG English speaking abilities. Breakfast is much better than the average offered in Venice. Hotel is well located with major attractions a short distance away although the charm of Venice is best discovered by "getting lost" Will stay here again on return visits to Venice. L& M Reeves. Calgary, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: DianeDiane
Reviews.Content: Took a double room at this hotel with my wife. Room was very small, but that was to be expected. The location in Castello was good for walking to many places. We had a small patio which was fun. Bed bit hard and pillows flat , but we found that in all the hotels we stayed t in Northern Italy. Cost was about $200 U.S. with breakfast included. This was the best "deal" I could find in very expensive Venice. Good location, full breakfast. Front desk people were friendly and helpful. Hardly five star, t hough.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: DGGDarien
Reviews.Content: We were a little uncertain about staying here because all we had to go on were the reviews on Trip Advisor. But we wound up having a wonderful stay. Our room was huge and clean - in part owing to the intelligent choice of not having carpeting - a wise move in such a humid environment. Our room faced the courtyard of the hotel, but we never heard any noise. We were able to walk to all the major tourist destinations and found some fun places on our own, just by wandering around. The staff was friendly and spoke enough English to suit us. The breakfast was always fresh and served in a cute dining room. They had free wi-fi or an internet-point computer which you could use - but there is a fee. Be aware that there is no elevator, so if you have mobility issues, request a room on the ground level (if you ask for the 1st floor, they may give you a room one flight up). We will absolutely stay here again, whenever we return. As a side note, I have heard from some people that you can do Venice in one day. While this may be true, I would recommend at least three. While you can do St, Marks' Square, the belltower, and Murano in one day, Venice is about wandering the streets, getting lost, and finding wonderful shops and restaurants. Do yourself a favor and give yourself the time to do more than the standard tourist fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: Eggie84
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel al Piave for 5 nights in August. The room was wonderful. There were 2 bedrooms so that we didn't have to pretend to all go to sleep at the same time. Our daughter's room had a separate air conditioning unit and both units kept the rooms comfortably cool in the hot August weather. The breakfast is great (eggs, cereal, breads, fruit) and the staff is very helpful. The free WiFi is excellent. We always had a very strong signal. The location is very good and the directions on their website from the vaporetto stop were perfect. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Efficient Service”
Reviews.Author: mover0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well managed. The staff speaks English, is very helpful friendly and responsive. The hotel is very clean. Breakfasts are very good. The hotel is close to Piazza San Marco and water bus stops. The rooms are air conditioned and though small by American standards, very comfortable. The hotel is exactly as represented when we booked it, and we are very satisfied. We would both recommend it and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Salathon
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Venice was made by this little hotel. It was lovely, down a little narrow street. We appeared to have the only balcony with our very own table/chairs. It was lovely. Bathroom was very clean. Breakfast in morning was good - scrambled eggs, croissants, yoghurts etc. In walking distance to everything and quiet at same time. Hotel staff very helpful with recommending great restaurants to eat. Will be returning for my 30th!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - lived up to the reviews I'd seen!”
Reviews.Author: ni_42
Reviews.Content: Great place, located between St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. On a narrow street but then lots of things are in Venice! We followed the directions given by 'jbearKent' on here - thanks jbearKent! A few winding streets from the San Zaccaria waterfront and we were at the hotel. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and gave us a map, pointing out some sights when we first got there. The breakfast choice was great: cereals, cakes, fruit, rolls, spreads, cheese, yogurts, drinks, and they always asked if we wanted cappucino and eggs with our breakfast! The room was great - larger than I'd expected with ensuite bathroom, wardrobe, TV, mini kitchen in a cupboard(!), phone, hairdryer, air conditioning, 2 windows but didn't get bitten by mosquitos! Great. Would like to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Al Piave Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneOakville_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 9 night stay at the Al Piave Hotel in the Castello area. We stayed in one of their separate apartments and it was plenty big enough for the three of us. Very, very quiet and air conditioned. We had a stove to cook on but most days we ate out at the many fabulous restaurants in Venice. The breakfast at the hotel was great and plentiful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience overall”
Reviews.Author: MariaRilke
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room here for three days in late May. Overall, my experience has been pleasant. The bed was quite spacious, the room nicely appointed â€“ a slight whiff of bygone times. The bathroom also left me satisfied. That being said, certain things need improvement. I canâ€™t speak for the other rooms at the hotel, but certain things in mine could use a little upgrading. For instance, the night table lamps â€“ though pretty â€“ didnâ€™t work properly; one of then did not turn on at all, the other did, but you had to wait about thirty seconds while abstaining from any sharp movements. I rarely do any bedtime reading while on vacation, but for some it may be an issue. Another thing was temperature control. The air condition worked (the city was under a heat wave for a few days), but the temperature was set on 16C (if memory serves me right), and could not be regulated, so it was too cold at night. The room safe was also a bit tricky to use, involving both a key and a little finger-twisting; in fact, it was the only non-electronic safe that I came across having stayed at five different hotels during my trip. Overall, nothing that really detracted from my experience at the hotel â€“ which was quite agreeable â€“ but I feel these things do need to be mentioned nonetheless. Front desk service was impeccable; the staff in general were delightfully helpful and friendly. The breakfast was fairly good. The location is excellent; about 7-10 minutes of brisk walking from the main action of Piazza San Marco. If youâ€™re arriving with heavy luggage and disembarking at San Zaccaria vaporetto stop (close to Piazza San Marco), add another 5-7 minutes. Considering that we're dealing with accomodations in what has to be the most expensive city in Italy, in my opinion, the value for the money is very good. I have no problems recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend Hotel Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoChet
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the staff was very friendly/helpful. They set up taxi services for us (even at 4 AM), provided recommendations, etc. and absolutely everything ran smoothly. We stayed in the two apartments that are a couple of blocks from the main hotel. The apartments were very clean and we had plenty of space for a family of six. The rates were excellent for the accommodations and service received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FrancesPatrick
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was basic but clean and comfortable, It was unseasonably chilly during our stay but central heat had been turned off for the year so we had none. The included breakfast was great..... capaccinos, breads, cereal, yogurt, fruit, mortadella, cheese, eggs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly people, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sfachime
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Venice, first time with the kids. We picked this hotel based on all of the excellent comments about it being a "family" hotel, rich breakfast, great value, etc. Location is indeed very nice, and hotel very clean. Owners/staff very friendly. But be careful about the "bait & switch" on the rooms. Booked the "Large Family Room" online and ended up put in a standard "family room", which is a less expensive room. Make sure you find out in writing before hand which room you will get and question the price. Also, must say breakfast was pretty standard, nothing to write home about. Still a nice hotel and would come back aside from those two complaints.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaSilva
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Al Piave in Venice was a delight. It was clean, the service was wonderful and the breakfast was great! The people running the hotel were extremely helpful with any questions we had about Venice. Although, it was a little hard to find, it wasn't any harder than any other hotel in Venice. It reminded me of a Bed & Breakfast in the states. The rooms were cozy, delightful and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable! Great Location! Awesome Owners/Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gioco_Poco_Ma_Gioco
Reviews.Content: I know everybody gushes about this hotel and its with good cause because for the kind of money you pay (and hotels in Venice can get pretty pricey) you get great bang for you buck! Yes the rooms are a little small but the washrooms are huge compared to some other European hotels we stayed in. No two rooms are the same either which is kinda cool. Our room had a balcony facing out in to the alley on the back side of the hotel. It was still fun just to hang out and drink wine and enjoy a smoke before we went out for dinner every night. Rooms we're extremely clean and comfy. Breakfast as pretty good in the morning. Eggs, if you asked, assorted cold cuts, bread, croissants, cereals and juices and coffee etc. It's been a few months since we've been there so I forget the young lady's name who owned and manned the front desk, but she was great and so was her father who worked mornings if I remember correctly. As a matter of fact we tried our best Italian on them when ever we had the chance and I think they appreciated it. As when I asked for a place to go and watch the Italy game during the Euro Cup I was given direction to a local "festa" (a street party, in this case for a saint, which one I can't remember). At this festa we were able to eat a huge plate of gnocchi with mushrooms, and a heaping plate of fried seafood, all for 7 euros each!!!! And this was down home Nonna-certified cooking. The drinks were cheap too - 2 euros/beer and 2 euros for a glass of home made wine... sweet! Oh yeah, and we got to watch the whole game with the locals on a giant screen in the town square, and then participate in their version of American (Italinan) Idol. Way too much fun!!! Ok back to the hotel. The location of this hotel is very close (10 min walk) to the Rialto Bridge, and another 10 mins to Saint Mark's Square. It's actually pretty central to all the major attractions. Even when we took a day trip from the train station we walked there, not more that 25 mins. We can't wait to go back and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jbearKent
Reviews.Content: wow what a find, i can't find fault with it at all. The hotel is lovely and the family that own it are friendly and make you feel very welcome. Despite other reviews saying hard to locate we found it with no problem at all, when you get off at San Zaccaria, go towards your left and take the calle de rasse which is on your right, go straight to to the top bear left and then go sharp right sort of ahead of you, up and over a tiny bridge over a small canal( an enterance to another hotel is just as you come over the bridge), up a very tiny alleyway and at the top turn left and you should be on the ruga guiffa, the al piave is a little way down on the left, not far from santa maria formosa. In all not even 10 mins walk from San Zaccaria. The newly decorated rooms are a must, well worth the extra money. Would we return to Venice, most certainly, and where would we stay the Al PIAVE.....

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: julianne24
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel in Venice can be overwhelming. We chose the Hotel Al Piave because: It had good reviews, especially for the breakfasts It was in a fairly central location but quiet It was good value for money Our flight from London arrived at midnight so we splurged and got a private water taxi. Definitely worth the money - I felt as if I was in a James Bond movie! We managed to find the hotel using their directions. Our party consisted of me, my husband, our teenage son, my mother and her husband. We saved money by sharing a 2 bedroom/1 bathroom suite, which actually had it's own entrance a couple of doors down from the hotel. The bedrooms and bathroom were spacious and clean. There was some street noise but we couldn't hear it with the windows shut - we ran the air conditioner to keep cool. The breakfasts were indeed, fantastic. You do have to inform the hotel what time you want breakfast, as the breakfast room is tiny. The staff spoke good english and were efficient and helpful, but not particularly friendly. We did get an extra discount on our bill by paying in cash, and also mentioning Rick Steves at the time of booking. We had 2 full days in Venice which, in addition to the main sights, gave us time to just wander away from the crowds. There is a restaurant 5 minutes walk from the hotel, Osteria al Mascaron, a Rick Steves recommendation which we thoroughly enoyed. We loved Venice and could have easily spent more time there.

Reviews.Title: “wondeful place to begin our Italy vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lyn001
Reviews.Content: A tiny but lovely hotel just a few blocks from St. Mark's Square. It was very difficult to find (buy a detailed street map, not the one available at the airport information desk), but a great place to stay once we found it. Rooms were small but quiet and clean, the staff friendly and most helpful, and the breakfast excellent (they offered fresh scrambled eggs every morning in addition to the "typical" Italian breakfast). It was a good value for the price. There was a pleasant restaurant just next door which served good food. Be sure the explore the surrounding neighborhood for a great sense of Venice, Don't pass this gem of a hotel by!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice!”
Reviews.Author: gcanceko
Reviews.Content: Lovely first stop on our European tour. We could not have asked for a more pleasant first leg accommodation. The entire hotel was impeccably decorated. Gorgeous tall windows and well-designed bathrooms that made the most of the modest space -- the oversized vanity was big-chain-worthy! The staff, esp. Mirella, was very helpful and courteous. We were able to book 4 nights for the price of 3! Breakfast was great -- a full spread with excellent espresso choices made to order. We didn't think it was hard to find at all! A good landmark is the Effe Erre Laundry spot -- also very handy. The best thing to do is head up from San Zaccaria vaporetto point or head down from Santa Maria Formosa Square (Ruga Giuffa is right off the square, SE corner). Very close to Calle Rasse (great inexpensive sandwich places) and La Boutique del Gelato!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Place”
Reviews.Author: LoveItaly2
Reviews.Content: My husband and 18 year old daughter just returned from our Italy vacation and Venice was our last stop. Hotel Al Piave was everything we expected and more (for the price); the front desk staff spoke english and was always helpful and courteous, the breakfast (included) was very good and the room was clean and well kept. The hotel was in a great location, although we did get lost while wondering around and could not find the hotel - ask the front desk for a map - we found out later their map was much more detailed than ours.
