Check out Burano it is a nice little treat. This was our first experience to Italy and Hotel Al Piave helped us enjoy every moment of it. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: erijen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Piave is a nice hotel with an excellent location in Venice. Good service, tasteful breakfast and good service. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No surprises at Hotel Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: Marcia47
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after researching Rick Steves and TripAdvisor. The hotel was what we expected, no more or less. The room we stayed in was the family suite with two rooms connected by one bathroom. It cost 280 euros per night, cash. While this seemed expensive, I can't be sure how it compares to other hotels in the area. The location was very good. Easy to navigate from, close to San Marcos and the Rialto bridge. The room was quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: Italy1Colorado
Reviews.Content: Al Piave was recommended by Rick Steve's so I started communicating with the owners by email. They had a "triple" which was one large bedroom with a queen-size bed & sofa attached to a room with a single bed (plenty of room & privacy for our 19-year old son) connected with a bathroom/shower. The rooms were immaculate, beds were very comfortable. The breakfast provided with the rate was very nice with a gentleman who cooked eggs the way you like plus breads, cheese/meats and juices. The same gentleman walked with us to our water taxi in the pouring rain to make sure we went to the right dock. I accidentally left my cell phone in the room and they searched until the phone was found and then shipped it to me in the US. This is a quaint, lovely hotel on a quiet alley with an easy walk to St. Mark's square. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Venice-generally a big ripoff .”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is not easy to find-especially if you're dragging luggage. We would have been better off if we'd taken a private water taxi directly there; however, the prices were prohibitively expensive. The ladies at the front desk were nice, but certainly weren't warm and never went out of their way to offer suggestions or recommendations (after an awesome experience in Florence it was a disappointment). The rooms are cozy, quiet and adequate, and the breakfast is just okay. There is no elevator in the hotel - our room was up one flight of stairs. Don't bother going to Venice at all if you have trouble walking, the whole city is difficult to get around, the signage is terrible and we got lost a lot. It's a very crowded city even "off season". Unless you love looking at touristy souvenirs, you don't need to spend 3 days in Venice-it's VERY overpriced-even compared to the rest of Italy (and the food isn't as good). You can definitely "do" Venice completely in one overnighter. Our very favorite place we visited was The Peggy Guggenheim Museum. And we do have nice photos from St Mark's, but once you've been there, it's just alot of pigeons and loud boats.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Al Piave - Just Book It!”
Reviews.Author: acegt1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid-April and were thoroughly pleased. I'm a bit of a paranoid traveler and read the TripAdvisor reviews religiously before booking a hotel. This place seemed to be in a great location and had good reviews so I decided to book it. Prior to our arrival I emailed the hotel and they were very prompt to respond and were quite friendly (and spoke great English!). I had a good feeling about the place from the beginning. After a short flight from Atlanta to JFK and then a long flight from JFK to Marco Polo Airport in Venice, we caught the Vaporetto to the San Zaccaria stop (~45 minutes) and followed the instructions to the hotel. A bit hard to find when you're sleep-deprived and in a confusing yet beautiful surrounding, but once you find it the first time it's easy to find after that. When we arrived we were surprised to find that they had our room ready even though it was only 9AM local time. I've found that during my many business travels to Europe it's rare to find a hotel that will let you check in that early. We appreciated it because we needed the sleep! The decor is a bit dated - there were pictures of naked cherubs on the headboard which became a bit of a joke to me and my wife, but we were surprised at the relatively large size of the room. It was like a mini-apartment complete with a separate bedroom, dining/cooking area (microwave, refrigerator, stove, pots/pans/dishes), and a TINY bathroom which is par for the course in Italy so we found. The owners/operators were incredibly friendly and the breakfast was quite good. I'm not a coffee fan, but the espresso was unbelievable! Aside from that, fresh fruit, toast, croissants, yogurt, cereal, juices, etc. were served each morning. Location was excellent - basically halfway between the Rialto bridge and St. Mark's Square. This is great because you're within striking distance of the tourist attractions without being surrounded by tourists! We got a good rate for telling them that we were Rick Steve's readers. The rate got even better because we offered to pay cash at check-out. Venice is beautiful, and the Hotel Al Piave made our stay even more enjoyable. Take it from a really picky traveler - this is the BEST value in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: Al Piave is a small and charming Venetian-style hotel in the less touristy district of Castello. My husband and I enjoyed six happy days here. Although itâ€™s the most expensive hotel weâ€™ve ever stayed in, it is fairly priced in a city of exorbitant prices. Our room, a standard double, was spacious enough for us, comfortable, well decorated, and most importantly, immaculate! I loved the wood and stone floorsâ€”there were no stale old carpets in this hotel! There was a heater that we could control ourselves and it was also nice when the radiator and the towel heating rack were on. The weather was chilly during our stay and so we did not have the windows open much; the view was of rooftops. We had everything we needed and the kind owners and clerks helped us in many waysâ€”from sharing interesting little stories about life in Venice to finding train schedules for us and printing them. The owner even gave my husband a good map to help us find our way through the labyrinthine passageways. The hotel held our bags for us on our last day so that we could enjoy more of Venice before our late afternoon departure, and they were forgiving when we discovered weâ€™d accidentally run off with the key after checking out that morning! I was glad to have the breakfast. It looked impressive on our first morning, but did remain exactly the same all week and could use a little sprucing up: cereal, yogurt, rolls, apricot croissants, fatty deli meat slices and cheese, canned fruit. The scrambled eggs were disappointing because they were flavorless, watery, and weirdly texturedâ€”not like fresh eggs--I wondered if they could possibly have been frozen or reheated from the day before. We did see the same cake for the better part of a week. There was also juice, tea, and (instant?) coffee. It is true that when you arrive, hauling your suitcases behind you over the cobblestones and up and down the steps to the several bridgesâ€”save your back, pack lightly--you may find it a little difficult to locate the hotel, but trust me, all of Venice is like this! If you get lost, just head for the main square of Santa Maria Formosa, face the bank and take the bridge to the right of itâ€”yes, that narrow passage is Ruga Giuffa! Finding it becomes easy after the first day. Although I think the breakfast needs a little improving, everything else was primo and you wonâ€™t find friendlier hotel staff anywhere else in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Return Engagement”
Reviews.Author: AnneNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Piave in the fall of 2006. When I decided to return to Venice with four friends in the early November 2007, I returned to the Piave. I was now familiar with the location and knew that the staff was pleasant and helpful. We ended up with one "family suite" and an adjoining double room on the top floor, so it was almost like having the entire floor to ourselves. The location is good: not so quiet that you don't get a good feel for the city, but not noisy. It's far enough away from the main tourist areas to that the streets are not too crowded, yet two different vaporetto options are within a short walk. There are many good restaurants and shops within the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: H1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after New Year. To be honest we didnt speend mcuh time there but it was fine. We had no probs and it was very cosy. The decor is very dated and breakfast didnt offer many options but apart from that it was fine. We didnt find it particularly easy ro find but then Venice is a bit of a maze. I probably wouldnt go back but not really for any particular reason, just that im sure there are nicer places.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly comfortable lodging”
Reviews.Author: ThatGirl299
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. The air conditioning saved me during an unexpected heat wave. The staff is friendly and their breakfasts are great. The location is nice and quiet off a small street. The room were of a good size; the bathroom was average but clean. Quaint decor and views. No elevator - we had to trudge our baggage up 3 flights of stairs but that was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: corneredmouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend over new years 07-08. We were given the "small" apartment. Although it wasn't the largest of apartments it was certainly big enough with a lot of character. The toilet was a particular adventure. The room itself was spotless throughout, cleaned every day including new years day. The linen, dishes, bathroom, kitchen were all immaculate. The staff were particularly friendly, spoke very good english (mostly) and were very willing to help. The breakfasts were simple but filling. The availability of a kitchen in the room and a nearby supermarket made our stay much cheaper. The location is fabulous. Castello is a lovely quarter of the city. Not too touristy but near everything that is. The Hotel Al Piave made our stay in Venice wonderful and it was an unbelievable start to the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alleen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon and loved it. It's very close to St. Mark's Square (about a 5 minute walk) and the neighborhood was very quiet at night. We rented the studio, which was very spacious. The bathroom was quite big. There was also a living area with a table and chairs, a kitchen stocked with dishes and pans, and a separate bedroom. The staff was very friendly, spoke English very well and proved very helpful with all of our questions. Also, the directions on the hotelâ€™s website were dead-on. Weâ€™d definitely stay at Hotel al Piave again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: hgw1996
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in Venice. Our room was 119, so it was very spacious with a cute view of the "street". Only downfall was that it could be quite noisy late into the night and/or early in the morning. But no big deal to us. The bathroom was a bit small, but still nice for European standards. Breakfast was great, crowded, but very accommodating. Hotel is difficult to find and forget any maps! Half the streets are not noted anyhow.. With some help from Venetians and just luck, we stumbled upon it. Hotel is in a great location (when you figure out where you are), just minutes from St. Mark's Square and great dining. The best meal we had was at the restaurant right next door.. Would recommend staying here. We had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nuonetwo
Reviews.Content: We just came home from 4 night at the hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was clean and plenty large enough for the two of us. The breakfast was wonderful. We had fresh fruit every morning. It was the best breakfast we had in 5 weeks of travel. There was a charge to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Moneychanger
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in we were assigned a tiny 1 bedroom apartment in a ground floor location a block away from the hotel. (thankfully there were no floods during our stay!!) Our ratings are based on this location as we only ever saw the lobby and breakfast area of the actual hotel. Good breakfast included. Internet available at a price. Good location close to all the tourist midway between Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Keep the windows closed”
Reviews.Author: CarinaJean
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised about this hotel on a little stree in Venice near St Marks. Our room was spacious and the bathroom brand new and shiney. My room had three windows, but any attempt to open should be avoided as there was a maloderous aroma, like bad chinese food. Perhaps the near by restaurant's cooking vent was in the shared alley. Nevertheless, very convenient, clean, and affordable place. A Rick Steve's pick.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frauke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Venice for the first time and choose this Hotel via recommendation by this website; we were not disappointed! The Hotel was very clean and rooms tidied daily. The Staff were all very friendly and breakfast was lovely. Try the cappuccino and scrambled eggs â€“ yum!!! The Hotel is very central and ok to find but make sure you have a good map prior to arrival. Italians are friendly and most speak English and are more than willing to show you the way should you get lost (which is not a bad thing as you will come across so much culture and beautiful little corners). Little tip; try the little restaurant â€œAgile Artisteâ€� right next door which have some very tasty and very reasonably priced food (compared to the other overpriced restaurants in the area) Try the tourist menus; 3 course and dessert between 19.50 and 22.50 Euro pp with very generous portions. We did not want to eat anywhere else after our first visit. A Hotel to be recommended - enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Al Piave: Always Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Felix_That_Cat
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Al Piave four times over the past 10 years or so. What a great place. It's close to San Marco (5 minute walk) but tucked away behind the Santa Maria Formosa and its piazza, so it's off the main drags. Since we're with the kids (and often with friends or relatives), we usually end up with a family suite across the street from the main hotel, with two full bedrooms and a wonderful bathroom. The rooms are spacious, the beds are great, the A/C actually works (well), and they put out a nice spread for breakfast, to boot. The owners and staff are helpful and efficient--never a complaint. Highly recommended, and near the best gelato in Venice (Boutique del Gelato, on the Salizada San Lio). We'd probably stay there even if the gelato wasn't so close...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central position”
Reviews.Author: Woody22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in September 2007 after reading other reviews. The hotel is really well positioned for Piazza San Marco and The Rialto Bridge and is located near Santa Maria Formosa square (quite easy to find). Our check-in was smooth, hotel very clean and up to date decor. Room was a little small but had air con, sat tv, queen sized bed, good shower (no bath). Breakfast was good and included scrambled eggs and the staff were all very friendly. My advice for getting there is to get the number 82 vaporetto from any water stop to Piazza San Marco and head towards the right of San Marco. The ask a hotelier/resteraunt owner etc for Santa Maria Formosa directions, it is fairly straightforward once you know the way but one wrong turn and you can get completely lost! We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfece 4-person suite!”
Reviews.Author: somedayTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in September 2007 in the 4-person suite (two couples). It was the perfect fit for us! We were looking for fabulous location, good value, and privacy for the two couples - and it was just that! Can't speak for the other rooms, but the 4-person suite is wonderful. It is across the street (really about 10 steps) from the main reception. The rooms are huge, just look at my pics. There was one entrance hall with two rooms and a huge bathroom. One room was bigger than the other - enough where the four of us would spend some time like a common room. The larger room had a fold out couch, and the smaller had an additional single bed. I imagine this would be perfect for families with three or four children. The room on the main street had thick windows that blocked street noise. The other room had windows over someone's private garden, and never heard a thing from them. We slept with the air conditioning on and it was completely quiet. Not quite sure why people have complained about mosquitoes...the air conditioning is very cold and our windows were always shut - didn't see a single mosquito. The decor is simply what you would find in any Italian apartment. High ceilings, minimal art, and wooden furniture - the room was lovely. It felt as if we were staying in someone's apartment, rather than a hotel. We had no kitchen, but did have a mini fridge. Rooms were very clean and the bedding was comfortable and soft. We felt very at home here, and always looked forward to ending the night with a bottle of wine in our "apartment." Breakfast is good. Scrambled eggs, cereal, fruit, yogurt, selection of meats and cheeses, and bread. The coffee with frothed milk is pure heaven!!! Staff was very helpful in arranging our reservation and with directions. I love the night time staff. The women during the daytime seem a bit frosty, but were helpful nevertheless. Directions on website for the water taxi Alilaguna are correct. I think people have just not realized that San Zaccaria stop has several piers that stetch along the waterway. If you walk off the end of the pier, your pier might not be directly in front of Calle de Rasse. Calle de Rasse is marked very clearly...don't go down a street unless you see the large Calle de Rasse sign. This was overall a fabulous stay. We paid 265Euro/night between two couples. That works out to be only 130 per couple in the heart of Venice - hard to beat that with location and value!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TheHuntsToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I read Travel Advisor and found the Al Piave lived up to the reviews given by other travelers. It was in a terrific location, the staff were professional (they booked a private tour of a glass factory in Murano, arranged for a privately guided tour, etc.). Our room was for three and was very cosy and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. One other thing to note. When we came in from the airport, I did find it a bit difficult to get to the hotel from the St. Marks square dropoff with all of our luggage. Next time I would invest and take a private water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbd
Reviews.Content: We were dissapointed with the hotel,particularly the bedrooms,which were dark and dreary.We suffered terribly with mosqito's particularly during the night.I realise Venice is an expensive place but for â‚¬170 per night I would have expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Our last night in Venice - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Fwapsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed our last night here and liked it very much. Small room, but comfortable and clean with private bath. Dont bring too much luggage to Venice, streets are narrow, and its tricky navigating the bridges and people while trying to find the hotel. (Great tip - Marco Polo Airport has luggage drop off on the first floor, so we only brought one bag to Venice and left the heavy ones at the airport!). Very close to San Marco which is the most expensive part of Venice but must be visited. (Tip #2: book the Secret Itinerary tour, its awesome!). Breakfast on the roof is beautiful. Well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: FergusWellington
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. We could not rate this one more highly. The staff are friendly and helpful and the location is fantastic for the key sites in Venice. The breakfast is really good and the coffee is expresso - definitely a plus. Even arriving by train, we used their site to get directions. This is well worth doing because Venice is not that easy to navigate. Would really recommend this hotel but please remeber there is no elevator!

Reviews.Title: “You are part of the family”
Reviews.Author: Slyclone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Piave for 3 days in May 2006. This is a family owned and operated 3 star hotel. We had the cheapest room. Yes, it was very tiny but nicely appointed (pictured), with a new bathroom, and clean. The front desk was very helpful booking us a reservation at Al Buco; maybe it was just coincidental we got a table on the canal under the Rialto Bridge (pictured). The breakfast was excellent. The owner took your drink order including the choice of cappuccino and hot chocolate. The free internet helped with travel logistics. The location was excellent midway between the Rialto Bridge and San Marcoâ€™s Square. Being off the beaten path kept the noise down at night. Our only complaint was it is two bridges and 10 blocks from the nearest water taxi making luggage lugging difficult. In fact, the owner saved us money by marking a map to catch the waterbus from San Zaccharia to the airport. It was only 10 blocks further and less than half the cost of a taxi. Just the kind of advice a dad would give. We enjoyed the food and hospitality served by Hotel Al Piave and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel. Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: grover13
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel. Wonderful staff, very helpfull. Rooms are a small, but very clean. Bathrooms are nice and clean. This is not a 5 star hotel, but if you want a great value for your money as well as a good location, this is it. Also great breakfast in the morning. I would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed-Upgrade necessary”
Reviews.Author: NYC91
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Al Piave for 2 nights in April during a week-long European adventure. I am a TripAdvisor fan, and always check before I go. I must say, I was a bit disappointed. The room we had (standard/cheapeast) was VERY tiny. We're talking open the door and falling onto the bed. The location is great. The breakfast is great too. I would suggest upgrading to the next level at least. I am sure the hotel is good for the price, but have stayed in Venice before at a location not as ideal in a much bigger room with the same level of service. Venice is easily walkable, so if comfort is a consideration, you might want to check the hotels a bit father out. Yes, you're not in your room for much of the time, but if you want to be more comfortable: upgrade or go further out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MomGreensboro
Reviews.Content: We were here just one night, with our two teenage children. Ilaria at the front desk spoke great English and sent us to a good nearby restaurant for lunch upon arrival. The rooms were clean and the bath modern. The cappucino was excellant as well as the breakfast. Definitely reccomend it for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: imagoose4u
Reviews.Content: All the reviews were accurate about this hotel. Thank you for the advice! We were very pleased with our choice to stay here. Some good things were: the location; it is very close to St. Marks Square and not too far from the waterbus station. The breakfast; not your average continental breakfast. They had scrambled eggs, fruit, pastries, meat, cheese, and they made you cappucinos to order. Our best breakfasts in Italy by far! They made our restaurant reservations for us and gave good recc. too. The price is fair considering we talked to other tourists who paid $300-400 a night for their hotels. Their rooms are very comfortable(air cond!) The whole staff is very kind and speak pretty good English too.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: TheHellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in June 2007. The hotel is in an excellent location, off the beaten path yet still close to everything. It is a short 10 minute walk to St. Marks square and the San Zaccharia vaporetto stop. It is also just down the street from the Formosa Square, which has a few shops/restaurants. The price is right too, much lower than places near the square. I think they only have about 20 rooms. Ours was fine, typical for a European hotel. Not huge, but who needs a big room when you are out sightseeing all day. It was quiet at night, which is great. Breakfast was good, the usual plus cappucino if you want it. I have to mention the great and friendly service. We had problems with our luggage and the staff at the hotel knew our situation (and how grumpy we were) and did everything to make us feel comfortable. They kept calling the lost luggage telephone line for us to find out any new information. We can't thank them enough for making us feel at ease until our luggage finally arrive. I highly recommend the Hotel Al Piave while in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sashina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights over Easter and would highly recommend it. My room was in an adjacent building, accessed off a courtyard beside reception, meaning it was possible to come and go without going through reception. The room was tiny, and would have felt even more so with two people. Likewise, the bathroom was poky with the smallest shower cubicle I have ever seen. It was all fresh and clean, however, and rooms were serviced daily. My room had a pleasant view of neighbouring rooftops - typical for Venice! - and was extraordinarily sunny, which made for very lovely mornings! Wireless internet connection was provided free - you just needed to ask for a password from reception. Breakfast was typical for Italy - cereal, fruit salad, yogurt, cold meat, cheese, fresh coffee, tea bags, non-chilled milk (!), oversweet orange 'juice' and average pastries and bread. There were a couple of hot options which I didn't investigate! The breakfast area was small and a couple of times was full when I arrived, although it was also possible to sit outside and eat, which may have been pleasant in a group. The reception staff were very helpful, though I am not the kind of traveller to be asking for much in the way of advice. I'd highly recommend the location - far enough away from both the San Marco and Rialto areas, but completely central on the island. This is great for airport transfers, as it's an easy walk to Fondamenta Nuove which makes for a shorter and cheaper boat trip to/from the airport than the San Marco jetties.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelMiam525
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Piave June 14 - 17, 2007. We are a family of four (2 adults and 2 teenagers). The rooms were great. It was like a small apartment. We had two separate rooms with a small hallway, with a large closet and a spacious bathroom. Our room was huge. It had a love seat, desk and a fireplace. It was beautifully decorated. The bathroom was very modern. The location is excellent. The breakfast is plentiful and very fresh. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dongola
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends in June and would stay again. It`s a good 3* hotel at a reasonable price(for Venice!). The rooms were small but nothing unusual for a 3* in Venice and the view was more or less non-existent (again not unusual) but they were very clean and there was a good supply of decent towels and adequate toiletries. The shower was fine,and the water was hot. There`s a tv in the rooms,showing CNN but nothing else English speaking but then who comes to this gorgeous city to watch tv? Breakfast was perfectly alright--mainly cold meats and cheese but also fruit(some canned) and cereals and scrambled eggs.Coffee and tea and hot chocolate were available.The dining area was a little cramped but you can sit outside as we did. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms,though I understand some rooms have a mini-bar but it depends on what you pay..a good deal on the net doesn`t get you one of the best rooms of course but ,again,you won`t be in Venice to spend a long time in the room.The stairs could be a problem if you aren`t reasonably able bodied though ,if you`re not ,the walk to the hotel could be a problem too.But then Venice isn`t the easiest city to get round if you aren`t reasonably mobile The hotel is in a great location which is the clincher.It`s about 10 mins walk to either St.Marks Square or the Rialto Bridge so it`s perfect for the 2 main areas.There`s loads of great restaurants nearby and little bars and cafes as well as shops.It is though quite difficult to find when you first arrive ,lots of winding alleys so be prepared for a hot walk from the waterbus stop and travel light if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Its all been said before - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RetiredFolk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned home from a 3 night long weekend at the Al Piave which we booked after reading the reviews on here. There is really nothing to add, it has all been said before. It is a super, well run hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Our room (115) was on the third (top) floor of a separate building a few metres along the 'street' which meant a climb up and down many stairs - ok if you are fit (or want to get fit!) but could be a problem for the less mobile. We even had our own rooftop 'patio'. There was nothing we could fault which is a very rare position to be in. We would definitely try to stay here again if we return to Venice but as Venice is just soooo expensive, we will sadly not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stinger10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Piave for 2 nights at the beginning of June 2007. We booked it primarily based upon the TripAdvisor reviews and were not dissapointed. The hotel is a little hotel located about 5 minutes or less from Piazza San Marco. It is very nicely kept and our room was one of the bigger, cleaner rooms we had in Italy. The hotel is family run and they were quite helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a little above average. The only slight draw back to the Al Piave may be the walk from the canal to the hotel, which is quite long if you are carrying a large suitcase but I suspect that is the same for most Venitian hotels with the exception of the 4-5 star hotels. Overall the Al Piave was great and we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: SicilySue
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located only a few minutes' walk from Piazza San Marco and the Grand Canal and vaporetto stops, Hotel Casci is a clean, quiet, well-run establishment. Our room was nicely decorated and the beds very clean and comfortable. The staff was most helpful in explaining how to get around in Venice. The breakfast buffet offered plenty of protein (eggs and meats), plus pastries, fruits, and caffe. The only negative - they charge by the minute for internet usage, the only hotel to do so on our trip. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone seeking a quality hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. This was a good, clean hotel near major attractions in Venice. The breakfast was sufficient and the staff was nice (and spoke English). The bathroom was a good size and the shower was larger than we expected. It was nice to have air conditioning, but the AC seemed to only have two settings on (very cold) or off. Nothing "wowed" us about this hotel. The rooms were small (although that's typical in Europe, and probably especially true in Venice); and the "view" out of our window was of the apartments next door (again, typical in Venice given the cramped city). From what I understand, the price was good for Venice (165 Eu/night)... although, be warned, Venice is an expensive city! :-) This review may not seem overly positive, but it may suffer from comparison to our stay at Residenza Cellini in Rome (which was outstanding).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Love2Ctheworld
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Al Piave. Our two-room suite was perfect for our 11-year-old son, my husband, and me. The room had the authentic Venetian flooring and beautiful wood-beamed ceilings. Very comfortable beds, too. Everything was clean, and breakfast was ample (they even had scrambled eggs, which made my husband very happy!). While it was a short walk to St. Mark's and to the Rialto bridge, we really enjoyed the square just up the road--Campo Santa Maria Formosa. It seemed to lack the throngs of tourists, and gave us a sense of local life in Venice, complete with children playing and dogs running after each other. It's also a cheaper place to secure a gondola ride.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: wagr
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 year old son and I recently spent three nights at this hotel in Venice. It is in a great location (only a 7-8 minute walk to Piazza San Marco once you learn the best route). The hotel was very clean and the rooms were nice. We had two rooms adjoining a shared bath. It is important to note that there is no elevator at this hotel and there are four stories with narrow stairs. There is a bellman available to haul your luggage upstairs though. The hotel encompasses two adjacent buildings and there is a small patio area with tables between the buildings which is a nice place to relax for a few minutes. We were able to walk everywhere and enjoyed the area around the hotel. On the same side of the street and just next door to the hotel is a nice restaurant - Tratorria Agli Artista - that we enjoyed. There are several small markets in the area that sell reasonable (for Venice - which is VERY expensive) water, sodas and wine. The room has a mini-refrigerator so you can stock it with your own provisions. The included breakfast was quite good - included cereal, eggs, breads, pastries, yogurt, cheese, etc. Tip - the hotel's website provides directions to the hotel from the waterbus that are a bit misleading. After exiting the water bus, turn left rather than right as instructed by the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't have a problem with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GregComo
Reviews.Content: Hotel al Piave is a great find, especially in Venice where hotels on the main island can be very pricey. The reviews on this site are spot on. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and accomodating. The rooms were spotless and the morning breakfast was delicious. We were visiting Venice on my wife's birthday and upon our arrival they updgraded us to a bigger room for free. One of the best features is the 5 minute walk to St. Marks. All other hotels this close to the square were almost double the price. One piece of advice: the hotel is a good 45 minute water bus ride from the Venice train station so if you are travelling by train be sure to give yourself some time.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Treasure”
Reviews.Author: VioletNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the cozy, immaculate, family-run Hotel Al Piave during the month of March and can not sing it's praises more enthusiastically. The moment we stepped into the hotel, which is steps away from both San Marco and Rialto, we knew we were in a special place. Everyone was welcoming, kind and helpful at every turn. We stayed in a second floor, charmingly appointed studio apartment with a full-kitchen and cabinets stocked with china, flatware, glasses etc. Each morning we enjoyed breakfast (included in your stay) in the hotel restaurant where owner Paolo would take special care of us. We felt like family and now have a Venetian home away from home. We've already booked this treasure again for June.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tammy_Y
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us in our group (2 couples). We rented the family suite at Hotel Al Piave which was great. The suite had 2 separate rooms, and a bathroom. One of the bedrooms had it's own sink which came in useful since we were sharing the other bathroom. By staying in the family suite, we were able to save some money, without sacrificing on quality. The hotel staff was very friendly, and they served an excellent breakfast, which included assorted meats, breads and cappuccino! The hotel was within walking distance to the major sites. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: VENICIANS
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at the Hotel Al Piave, in central Venice. Lovely quiet place. It's a family run business belonging to Ilaria, Mirella and Paolo. Stylish and clean rooms. The staff are very friendly and helpful making our stay at their hotel a very enjoyable experience! Hotel Al Piave is full of character. Breakfast is a real treat, especially the eggs and Paolo makes a fantastic capachino! We will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: marcusck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during April 2007. All the positive reviews are correct - this is a great hotel. High points: - Very clean rooms and hotel; spotless. - Rooms were of a good size for couples, although you could probably only fit one other single cot for a baby in the room. - Hotel staff couldn't be more helpful and spoke english and german (and probably more languages). They gave good directions, i.e. how to catch water bus then road bus to Treviso airport (which is a pain if you are flying Ryanair). - Breakfast was fine, and had the opportunity to sit outside in their little alcove which was nice on warmer mornings. - Location was fabulous. Very close to St Mark's square, which is where all the action is. This also makes it easy to get to if you are catching the water bus in from Marco Polo airport. Location also meant there were more than enough good restraunts nearby. - Rooms were very quiet and peaceful and airconditioned. No problems with the mosquitos. Downsides: - Honestly not many. For the price of this hotel (100 pounds sterling in high season per night) this was a great hotel. -

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable, charming, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chitownee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! First of all, when we got there they upgraded our room from one queen size bedroom to a suite type room with an extra bedroom inside our room. It was quite spacious for Venice hotels. The lady at the front desk was very young, spoke English, and very helpful. It was located in a quaint area that had nearby squares with very tasty restaurants. I would stay at this hotel again. If you get a chance, eat at Osteria Mascaron around the corner from the hotel...get the antipasti. Very tasty. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy_Clarke
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel expressly based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. Key points in its favour: central location close to all the main sights; good price; friendly staff; cleanliness. Against: difficult to find - but more a problem of Venice's narrow streets and bad mapping; narrow walls between rooms and sound transfer; moderate quality breakfast but included within room rate! There are rooms of different quality, so you pay your money and take your choice!

Reviews.Title: “A great time and a good value!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily75
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a stay at the Hotel Al Piave, and we had a wonderful time. We had a two room suite at a very reasonable price. The hotel was exceptionally clean and very comfortable. In addition to the property itself, the staff was pleasant and helpful to us throughout our stay. I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel...”
Reviews.Author: warye77
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in close proximity to all the main attractions. Situated in a quite street with very friendly staff that speak perfect English! Very clean hotel and good sized rooms. What more could you ask for! Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and hospitable B and B”
Reviews.Author: bwphd
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel within 5 minute walk to San Marco Plaza and San Zaccharias vaporetto stop. Be sure to use their own website to book as it has excellent walking directions from the boat stop. Also, cash discount available if you book through them and pay cash. Expedia requires credit card. Like most of Venice, try to not bring much luggage as you have to haul it from the boat. Very quiet hotel. Friendly owner. We got an excellent price for our family with a double room connected within single room (for our teenager), sharing the bath between the three of us. This was an upgrade over the triple that we had prepaid for. Good choice in the continental breakfast. (Unlike other reviews, no eggs or hot breakfast on the days we were there). Ignore the description on the hotels.com website as it seems to describe a hotel with the same name that is actually somewhere else... but the address is correct (Rugia Giuffa 4838). Double room was larger than other rooms in Europe that we had, including a sofa and large wardrobe. Would always stay here on a return trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Hotel Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: SoapQueen
Reviews.Content: We (my son and I) recently returned from a trip to Italy and our first stop was two nights in Venice. I'd read about Hotel Al Piave on TripAdvisor.com and chose it because it was in a good price range for us and had high recommendations in TripAdvisor. We were extremely pleased with what we found. The hotel itself is tucked about a 5 min at most walk behind St. Marks Square, so it's very well located and is very quiet. We were surprised to get a two room suite for the price of a double upon our arrival. The staff was helpful in suggesting dinner and the breakfast was wonderful: pretty little setting and white linens with great cappuchino, fresh hard rolls and italian salami with a couple of different cheeses, along with cereal, some fruit, scrambled eggs, yogurts, and pastry. It was a great way to start the day of managing to get around the city. The two rooms were of a very nice size with a twin bed in one room and two twin beds made into a king size in the main room and we slept great. The bathroom was small and the shower even smaller, but it was extremely clean and we didn't mind the size at all. Without a doubt if we ever returned to Venice, we wouldn't even look for any other place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor is right again!”
Reviews.Author: mmbinFtL
Reviews.Content: Once again, Trip Advisor got it right. Our stay was from November 4 to 6 and 13 to 15, with a Costa cruise in between. This is a small, historical, family-run hotel in a wonderful location, close to all of Venice's major sights and a short walk from the San Zaccaria water taxi stop. We spent our first two nights in a two bedroom "suite" and though it was just my husband and I, the "space" was a pleasant surprise. It was clean, as past Trip Advisor postings have confirmed, and well appointed. Though it was a two story climb (yes, there is no elevator), our bags were quickly moved to our room without asking. Our final stay was only one floor up to a nice size, equally well appointed room with high ceilings and a great bath. Breakfast at Al Piave is better than on the Costa cruise, with real, fresh scrambled eggs (a first for us in Italy), Italian meats and cheeses, hot and cold cereal, fresh breads, rolls, croissants and pastry, and they make the best cappuccino. The family is bilingual, very helpful and even arranged for us to share a private water taxi, at considerable savings, for a 4:30 AM departure to the airport. Al Piave is now our place to stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Builderpop
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Venice, September 9 2006, and the Hotel Al Piave was the second for my wife, daughter and myself. On our first visit in 1999 we stayed at the Savoia & Jolanda right on the Grand Canal. Our room at the Savoia & Jolanda (as I recall) were somewhat small but very elegantly decorated with a rather small bathroom. The main attraction for my wife and I was the location of the Savoia and Jolanda on the Grand Canal. Things are a lot different seven years later, Riva degli Schiavoni would become almost deserted and San Marco had very few people milling about the square in the evening. especially after the day tripper tourist would head back to the mainland. San Marco and Riva degli Schiavoni now remain crowded with tourist until late at night. During the day, Riva degli Schianvoni becomes so crowded it's almost impossible to walk thru the sea of humanity flooding the streets and San Marco. The Hotel Al Piave is located 5 minutes walk from San Marco and the Grand Canal, which I found to be a relief from the oppressive crowds on Riva degli Schiavoni. The only negative, that comes to mind is the hotel's directions. Once we found the hotel, the yound lady working the front desk greeted me with excellent English and a pleasant manner. Our room really was actually a mini-apartment located in a seprate building on the second floor (sorry no elevator). The room itself was actually two seperate bedrooms with a shared bath. The rooms were huge and had seperate A/C units that we could control. The furnishing and overall cleanliness were superior. The beds were comfortable and housekeeping cleaned the room without any issues. I dealt with three seperate desk clerks while staying here, one was the wife of the Owner (sorry I didn't get her name), all were pleasant and willing to spend time answering any questions I had. I was offered a discount for cash, my total bill for two nights came to 510.00 euro, which included breakfeast. All things considered, this is a "Bargain" for the level of service and the quality of the room in Venice during "high" season. I would most definetly recommend the Hotel Al Piave and will stay there on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on part of our honeymoon. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the public water taxi and in Venice that means through narrow streets and over about 2-3 bridges, but the directions given to us by the hotel were EXACT. It is in a very quiet and convienent location, but doesn't have any views. The owner was very accommodating and helpful. Overall it was a clean and charming hotel. They will help you with whatever you need.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ssoloway
Reviews.Content: A very nice "bed & breakfast" type hotel in an excellent loaction...just a few minutes walk from St. Mark's square, and right around the corner from a water taxi stop...next to a lovely little square with restaurants, ATM machines & souvenirs, but not too crowded. The owners were very nice and helpful, and the breakfast was also very good. Internet access. Avoid the room with the "terrace" unless you like hiking up 3 flights of stairs! All-in-all, a very pleasant stay for a reasonable price. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with Family Room”
Reviews.Author: lbes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel al Piave was a very good value in a nice location. About a ten minute walk from St Mark's square. Finding our way there was half the fun - directions on the website are pretty good, and the locals were all helpful in steering us in the right direction. We stayed in the Family Room with our 18 and 13 year old - very convenient, with two separate rooms that share a bathroom and corridor. Plenty of towels, soap, shampoo. Airconditioning was great because we were able to close our windows to keep out the noise of restaraunts and very noisy pedestrians. Staff was courteous and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: morninglory177
Reviews.Content: Hotel al Piave was a great first time to Venice place to stay! Reasonably priced and very clean. The room we had was a tad small but since we were hardly ever in it that made it okay. Getting to the hotel from the airport is not easy after an all night flight from the US. Taking the vaporetto from the airport is a trek in itself to get you and your luggage to it. Then getting off at the right stop is not too hard but if you aren't not in good physical shape then you need to get a private water taxi to transport you to the hotel. The trek to the hotel lugging all your luggage is a feat! My hubby and I both had two pieces each [one small, one medium] of luggage and we did fine until we had to lug them over the little bridges [lots of steps!] If I had to do it over again I would hire the private taxi! After Venice we were taking a cruise so we paid the price and took the private water taxi to the cruise ship. It picked us up literally right outside the hotel a few hundred feet. The hotel made the arrangements and it was painless but expensive! But definitely worth it!!! Never the less, I would absolutely stay here again! We loved it! Venice was very fun but horribly crowded. My hubby and I will go back when there's not so many people. Make sure you ask the fron desk for a dinner reccomendation! The little gal there reccommended one right around the corner from the hotel. It had a wonderful outdoor courtyard! The food was delicious and the waiter we had was very entertaining. It made our evening just perfect! I cannot wait to go back to Venice! One of my very favorite places to go! Make sure you spend the extra money for a gondola ride. You get a perspective of Venice you can't get on foot.

Reviews.Title: “As good as we'd hoped!”
Reviews.Author: IowaninUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Piave July 27-30, 2006. We found the hotel on this website and were pleased to find it exactly as described in prior reviews. The great air conditioning we had in our room offered a welcome reprieve from the hot temperatures outside. Everything was extremely clean. Restaurant recommendations we were given each afternoon were great (especially the first 2 nights!) and reservations were made for us. We were made to feel welcome at the restaurants and were given very good tables. At one that offered outdoor seating, if we would have dropped a fork from the table it would have fallen into the Grand Canal! The Alilaguna we took from the airport didn't stop at the San Zaccaria landing, we would have had to wait longer at the airport landing for one that did, so we got off at San Marco/St. Mark's Square but we were able to walk right to the hotel using the map and directions from the Al Piave website. Everyone was very efficient, professional, helpful and friendly and we'll definitely stay there again when we're back in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy G
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel al Piave in early Jun. We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site and were not disappointed in the least. The hotel was very clean and quiet. The included breakfast was always delicious even near the end of breakfast at 10am. Every member of the staff that we encountered was always friendly. We had a special situation that we were arriving on a Sunday at 11:30pm and they confirmed our reservations and gave very detailed instructions to help speed our way. I would whole-heartedly recommend this hotel for a trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnatitravelguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3 kids (14, 10 and 6) just stayed at the Al Piave. We were referred to this hotel by a coworker of mine. We reserved the suite which effecitively was two full units. Rooms were cosy and had character and the AC worked great. Breakfast was good with hot eggs and various other pastries and coffee. Staff was helpful. I would stay there again. Before going making your way to Venice and to this hotel, get good directions. The streets are basically sidewalks and if you are walking with luggage it would be easier to know exactly where you are going. The directions on the website are not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo for al Piave”
Reviews.Author: OdiseoPR
Reviews.Content: My familiy and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in early June, 2006. We found it to be an excellent small hotel. Our rooms, located in the main building, as well as the bathrooms and public areas were comfortable, very clean, and had a fresh new look. Good airconditioning. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast, which is included in the price of the room, was excellent and generous, including freshly cooked real scrambled eggs, hot and cold cereals, cheese, breakfast meats, croissants, etc. Coffee, tea and chocolate were all very good. The hotel provides a tray should you desire to take your breakfast up to your room. Al Piave is located in a street that is very quiet at night and very lively during the day. A restaurant that is not part of the hotel, located next door to the hotel entrance is quite good and reasonably priced. There are a couple of other restaurants in the same street, all moderately priced. On that street you will also find a small street market selling fruits, vegetables and the like, a convenience store that sells bread, ham, cheese, beer, etc., and a laundry. Bancomats for your ATM cards are in a nearby piazza. Both the Piazza San Marco and the Canal Grande (Riva degli Schiavoni) are a short 5-10 minute walk away, through interesting streets with lots of stores, cafes, restaurants and such. One can also walk quite easily to the Rialto. Some caveats: As pointed elsewhere in this forum, there is no elevator and the rooms can be quite small, as is usual in these types of hotels all over Europe. We would definitely stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McLeanVA
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a lovely hotel. It's tucked in a quiet street that is convenient to all tourist sites -- a bit tricky to find at first but worth the trouble! Everything was immaculately clean and the rooms were quiet. The lobby and breakfast room are beautifully decorated with Venetian paintings, glassware and gorgeous lamps. Breakfast was very good, including scrambled eggs. One warning -- there is no elevator. We were on the third floor and it was quite a workout getting our luggage up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cathy47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was wonderful...hot scrambled eggs every morning plus cheese, meat, bread, cereal, and fruit. They can arrange a free trip to Murano, but you have to arrange to get back yourself which is not a problem at all. This is a family owned hotel, which I think makes them work harder to make their guests happy. We would without a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the off-site apartment”
Reviews.Author: kimkauai
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Al Piave based on recommendations, but ended up in Apartment 1 which was not very nice, and extremely noisy due to some sort of equipment that is stored in the apartment. Make sure if you're booking a room there, that you aren't in the apartment. Otherwise, breakfast and staff were just fine at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to revive the tired traveler!”
Reviews.Author: bbmom101
Reviews.Content: We were simply delighted upon our arrival to find a clean, spacious room (& bathroom). The hotel is centrally located yet tucked away from the hectic streets and peak tourist locations. The breakfast was one of our favorites -- with eggs included! I would recommend getting good directions from the staff before locating it. We used a city map from a popular travel writer and were greatly disappointed in locating ALL of the hotels during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: May, 2006 Exceptional hotel! Perfect location. Outstanding staff! Knowledgeable, helpful, and kind! The rooms are spotless, and the breakfast is extensive. Very affordable. In a city as beautiful as Venice, this is a diamond in the rough! We canâ€™t wait to go back to Venice, and wouldnâ€™t even consider staying anywhere else! [--]

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debkatie
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel: quiet location but close to San Marco Square; great family rooms -- i.e., a bedroom for the adults, and a separate, twin bedroom for a young adult or child. Decent breakfast included in the price and one of the more comfortable beds we found in Italy. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrcmry
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nite last week at this lovely small hotel. Staff was attentive, breakfast good, rooms clean and well lit. Highly recommend this place to all.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need, it is great”
Reviews.Author: rockytherockstar
Reviews.Content: We just returned from trip to Italy and stayed at this hotel. It was exactly what we wanted. Tucked back in, away from the crowded streets along the waterfront and centrally located. We had reservations at this hotel and the Hotel Marconi at the Rialto Bridge. The price difference was about $300 between the two, so opted low based on the reviews on this website. After we got there we were so happy we did not fall for the novelty of staying on the Grand Canal. The crowds were constant and I'm sure it was noisy at night. Hotel Al Piave is a great place to stay in Venice. The walks to the waterfront, the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco appear longer on a map. Staff, breakfast and rooms were all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- for Family, too”
Reviews.Author: WSUCougs
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in a book called: Venice Top 10 and then researched it on Trip Advisor. We stayed at Hotel Al Piave May 14-16. We had a family suite in the annex just down the road from the main hotel (rooms 112 & 114). The rooms were located on the second floor and we had our own floor. This was a great room for families. My husband, 12 month old, mother and father were traveling together. When you walked into the suite there were two doors to your left and a bathroom directly in front of you. My parents stayed in one room and we stayed in the other. It was perfect for us -- my husband and I could go out for dinner while my parents watched the baby, but could be in their own room. The bathroom was nice size as were the rooms. Both rooms could sleep three adults (they provided a playpen (or "cot" as they call it in Europe) for the baby. One of the rooms is a bit larger than the other and it has also the tv and fridge in it. We are going back to Venice in December (we live in Italy) with friends and will stay at Hotel Al Piave -- rooms were spacious, breakfast was great (including scrambled eggs!) and the location was very central to exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location between San Marco and Rialto. Clean rooms, staff speaks 6 languages, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Al Piave was a great find.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Piave in October, 2005 for two nights and enjoyed our stay immensely. We found the hotel in Rick Steves' Italy 2005. We took a water taxi to the hotel. When we left, the hotel called us a water taxi and the driver picked us up at the hotel . He and the bellman carried our very heavy luggage all the way to the taxi. The staff at the hotel were very, very nice and quite helpful. Our room was very large and very nice. The bathroom was large and very clean. Breakfast was wonderful. The only disttaction was that there was not elevator. Lovely place to stay and would do so again, in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: milessan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days in Venice at the Hotel Al Piave. With 30+ years of travel under my belt, I have learned that luxury is not necessarily an "adequate" room at the Hotel Danieli for a fortune, but may be an affordable family run hotel, centrally located in a city which is very expensive. As mentioned, the hotel is perfectly located. It's a few minutes walk from San Marco, about an 8 minute walk from the Rialto, and just a block from Campo Santa Maria Formosa. The Al Piave is in a neighborhood with a small grocery (water, wine, orange juice, soda, salami, cheese, bread, etc.), a green-grocer a few doors away (lettuce, tomatoes, pears, apples, etc.) and two pastry shops. As for the hotel. We (adult daughter - 25 years old and I) had a "mini-suite" in the annex just down the street from the main hotel. It had a tiny sitting room with TV, mini-bar, table and two chairs. The bathroom was completely updated --- tiled, adequately lighted, small "server" for make-up, etc., shower with ample hot water, and towel warmer. The bedroom (while again small --- it's Venice) was terrific. We had a king-sized bed (firm, and better than most I've had in far more expensive hotels). There were also individual reading lamps (and little night-lights). Linens were clean and crisp. Towels were plentiful. Views from both the bedroom (onto a little square with a well-head) and from the "sitting area" (onto another little square) were just wonderful. The family running the hotel obviously takes pride in their establishment. Their standards are high. Everything ran smoothly and the room was immaculate. Their cleaning staff is truly amazing. I cannot say enough about how our rooms were maintained. Ilaria and her family (we also had extensive conversations with her mother) were extremely helpful in all respects. They provided information about Venice, booked concert tickets, made restaurant suggestions and reservations, allowed free internet service (so we could check our mail), arranged transportion to the airport, and generally helped us with all issues in Venice. Venice can be a very expensive city. I cannot imagine a better value and experience than this hotel. I have never written a review before, but I've been impressed with Trip Adivsor. I hope I've provided information which will help you make decisions about your trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: gingerholly
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Al Piave at the beginning of Carnivale. Loved Venice, loved the Al Piave! Owners are very welcoming as is their dog, Molly. The hotel is charming, rooms and breakfast are great! Terrific location! We did not want to leave!! You will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrantMorris
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 5 days in Venice and stayed at the Hotel Al Piave. This is a family run hotel and you get the feeling that you are being welcomed into their home. The hotel is within easy walking distance of St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. In fact it is really handy for all the major attractions. The bedroom and the bathroom were spotlessly clean and my request for extra pillows was acted upon there and then with no fuss. Breakfast was great too with bread rolls, ham, cheese, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fuit salad, tea or coffee and orange juice. Every morning Paolo could be heard offering eggs. Excellent service from everyone in the hotel, with Ilaria (I think that was Paolo's wife, if not it was Mirella) speaking very good English and able to book trips and advise on where to go. All in all great experience and I wouldn't hesistate to recommend staying at the Al Piave to all my friends and family. We didn't want to leave and we can't wait to go back. Check it out it's really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: kkeener52
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Al Piave is a great place to stay. I have been there with three different girlfriends, and all three enjoyed their stay in Venice, as well as Hotel Al Piave. The staff has always been the most courteous and helpful. While seemingly away from the heavy traffic, it is a wonderful location, so close to the ever stunning St. Marco!!! Would highly recommend Hotel Al Piave.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. After staying in a pretty dumpy hotel in the Canareggio region of the city, we booked this hotel at the last minute for the rest of our stay. Although upon check-in we were informed that we would have to stay in another hotel as our AC was broken, the manager agreed to relocate us to a delux double for the same price. Our multi-leveled attic room was beautiful, with a flower-covered private terrace. The decor is unique in each room, but ours was charming, with exposed ceiling beams, warm lighting, etc. This hotel was spotless and the service was impeccable. After our initial problem, every member of the staff went out of their way to help us with food, transportation, tourist information and placing international phone calls. Don't miss a chance to stay at this beautiful little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and location”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel al Piave through the Frommers guide, and followed up with a visit to the hotel's web site. It looked like a small, friendly hotel and an outstanding value: we called to check on rates and found that the hotel gives a discount for cash and booked us over the phone, confirming by e-mail. On arrival, we took the water bus from the airport to St Marks square, then walked to the hotel. You need a map, even if you know Venice: it's a twisty walk to the hotel, but suitcase-friendly (no stairs to navigate) and about a ten minute stroll. The hotel is located along a narrow street (aren't they all), full of charm, in a neighborhood street lined with shops, stores, restaurants, laundromat a block away. It felt more like a residential area than a tourist shopping one, but very safe and comfortable. Watch for the labeled hotel lantern over the street or you might miss the door. The lobby is warm and wood, the greeting warm and friendly. They checked us in quickly and efficiently, showed us across a courtyard to our room (up a flight of stairs), and left us to settle in helpfully without being obtrusive. The room was very good: a large bed in the main room (actually two twins pushed together and covered with a sheet), and a smaller single in a curtained alcove. Closet and drawers were abundant, and the heating worked well. The tiled bathroom was about twice the size of a standard hotel one: stall shower, bidet, nice sink, good lighting, no tub. The street noise is present, but not unreasonable: it's a few blocks off the main tourist artery and foot traffic thins out considerably after dark. The hotel feels like a small B&B: the staff is very personable and helpful: they sold us tickets for the waterbus at standard rate (putting the charge on our bill when requested), gave helpful recommendations to nearby restaurants, and were very considerate about asking if we minded their friendly dog in the lobby (we didn't: it's a sweetie). The small restaurant off the lobby serves a good breakfast in the morning: there is a buffet with a good assortment of breads, fruits, cheeses, and cereals. The proprietor asked if we'd like eggs, and prepared lattes (and a refill!) to accompany the meal. The breakfast was included in the room rate, and there was no pressure to purchase any add-ons. Overall, this is a very friendly and comfortable hotel, centrally located, and an incredible value for room and breakfast, especially if you pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: KRPickles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed this hotel. It was the first place we stayed on our 2-week trip to Italy. The room was quiet and relaxing and very clean. Also, it is just a couple of minutes from St. Mark's. The staff were very friendly and made us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kim_Kai_Trev
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Piave, The moment we stepped through the door we felt like we had found a home in Venice.This Hotel is well situated to see all the sites.The people who own and run this property love what they do and it shows even the window sills and shutters outside the rooms are clean.They take as much care with thier guests as they do the hotel.In the morning you are greeted with smiles ,incredible coffee and breakfast full of choices.Help and a map is just steps away at the front desk (in English) to find your next site to explore.We stayed in a lot of hotels on our trip in Europe and this was by far the best value. A Very Happy Traveller :^)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel al Piave is a perfect little hotel, off the beaten path, but easily accessible. The staff is friendly and efficient, the hotel is very charming and well-maintained, and the breakfast is excellent. The quality was the same on this trip as it was two years ago, a testament to the family who own and run it. Our small group was very impressed and would definitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to hotel al piave on our honeymoon. Are room was charming and clean and the hotel is very central. We had a great time. The owners of the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We even got a recommendation on where to buy a venician chandelier! I would certainly recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: heretothere_7
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the water taxi. A great location within Venice and the room was very quiet. The rooms are very clean and have everything necessary to make for a comfortable stay. The staff was helpful with all our questions and our needs. We stayed for 3 nights and would definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends and would stay again on a return trip to Venice. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ilaria was so helpful over the phone when we were making arrangements that we felt right at home when we arrived. As a group of six, it was difficult to find accomodations without the expense of renting 3 rooms, but Al Piave owns a studio apartment and a suite that are located a few blocks from the hotel. Ilaria made it all possible, otherwise we would have been split up in different rooms. Instead, we had all three floors to ourselves, a studio on the first floor and a two-floor suite upstairs. We stayed for a week, and wish it could have been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalStyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably our least favorite during our trip to Italy. First off, the rooms are small, even for European standards. The staff are not as friendly as some of the other reviews said they were. The location is great, but Venice is so small that it is never more than a few minutes to the center of town. The positives were that the hotel was clean and the air conditioning worked great. I would probably find another place to stay, especially since this place wasn't cheap either....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here for two nights of our 12 day European vacation. It was our favorite hotel. The room was small, but it and the bathroom were very clean. The staff was extremely helpful and the location was great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: DebraLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, lovely and clean with air conditioning (which was definitely needed!) in the room. Great location, close to St Marks Square and Rialto bridge, and importantly to us, close to the water bus. Great breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravellingTLT
Reviews.Content: Very nice family run hotel. Location is good, within walking distance of the train station, if you donâ€™t take lots of bags. Stayed 6 nights (April 2005) in room #116. Very small room, although the bathroom was large. Both were extremely clean. Had refrigerator. Staff very helpful and above average. Lots of noise from people walking/talking in the little street/alley in front of the hotel. Closing the windows is a must if you want to sleep. If it had been hot, it would not have been good, since the hotel had not yet turned on the AC. So be very careful in the shoulder seasons. Find out the temps and if the AC is turned on yet or you will most likely be very uncomfortable trying to sleep. Breakfast consisted of bread, cold cereal, juices, canned fruit. Plenty of coffee and tea. There were some cheeses and crackers. Definitely helped to fill up before a day of tourist activities. You will not find a place that serves breakfast. Suggest renting the room with breakfast. It is worth the extra 5 Euros. The towels were very nice in this hotel; Terry cloth and they had washcloths, hand, and bath towels. This hotel was 135 Euros (cash) a night with breakfast in April. I would highly recommend this hotel. Restaurants recommended: â€¢ Trattoria Agli Artiste: pizza, Salmon pasta, Lasagne Bolognese, salad were very good; located next to Hotel al Piave; the service was spotty at best; because of convenience to hotel and lots of restaurants closed certain nights of the week, ate here 4 times â€¢ Trattoria Ai Greci: Excellent seafood; a bit pricey

Reviews.Title: “Great innkeeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dear , My sister and I had a wonderful visit with Ilaria, Mirella and Paolo. The best of all our lodging experiences in Italy was our three night stay at hotel al Piave. They have mastered the art of running a hotel! Theyprovided excellent service whether it was arranging a glass factory tour, recommending a restaurant, giving directions, and even giving panino to me on our last day. Everyone was gracious, friendly, helpful, and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Truly loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Piave for two nights in June, 2005 prior to our Mediterranean Cruise. What an excellent choice we made by staying here. The staff are so welcoming and helpful in every way. From taking our many bags to our room to arranging a water taxi to take us the port to giving recommendations on restaurants. We stayed in a family suite for 3 and there was ample room for 2 adults and a teenager. Breakfasts every morning was delicious. My husband believes they have the best coffee at this hotel. We were within walking distance to every attraction we wished to see. We had a great time there and highly recommend Hotel Al Piave. When we next visit Venice we will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small but full of character”
Reviews.Author: coronadolauren
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, a simple 5 minute walk to San Marcos Square and 10-15 mn to the Grand Canal. The website does a poor job at supplying accurate pictures so don't make the same mistake I did, and go with an open mind and not a set expectation. You also must walk up stairs to your room. Everything was in good shape and very, very clean. The breakfasts lack in variety, but can be filling if enough is eaten!! Overall, we enjoyed staying at Hotel Al Piave.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, I was even more hesitant about choosing this hotel. It seemed too good to be true, but I bit the bullet and decided to give it a try. The hotel was awesome. Great value for money, compared to many hotels in Venice. The room was spotless. Small, but that's Europe. Bathroom was clean. Breakfast was above average for continental style. Coffee was amazing. Location was great. I highly recommend this hotel. As for directions, I suggest you get off at the San Zaccharia stop instead of San Marco, if you're taking the Alilaguna.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Paxi
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us traveling together. We booked 4 rooms at Al Piave. One had 2 large bedrooms with queen size beds and a bath. The others had a larger bedroom with a qeen size bed and a smaller bedroom with a twin bed and of course a bath. Also, there were hairdryers in the bathroom but they were not very powerful like the ones in Rome were. Just a thought! We all had a wonderful experience with the rooms...very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the rooms were large by European standards. The staff is very accomodating and friendly. The quaint dining room in the main area was lovely and the breakfast was very good. We were within walking distance of everything. The Rialto Bridge was about a 10 minute walk and St. Marks is about 7 minutes. We took a walking tour with a great guide and the hotel was very convenient for him to meet with us. The directions to get to the hotel say to get off the vaparetto at St Mark's square but my suggestion would be to get off the vaparetto where you see Hotel Danieli and go down the stree to the left of the hotel. That takes alot of walking off of your trip to the hotel. It really isn't that far from there. On the way out, we asked the staff to arrange a water taxi to the train station and they had the taxi meet us at the bridge right near the hotel. If you are taking a water taxi from the airport or train station to go to the hotel, you might want to ask the staff where to have the taxi drop you! We would all definitely stay there again. ENJOY VENICE, it is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, and reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: Collington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Piave after trolling through (what felt like) millions of Trip advisor reviews. Our four night visit was mostly pleasant and what we expected. The location was good -- it was close to everything we wanted. Our room had a double room & a single room sharing a bathroom. The double bedroom was incredibly spacious and the single room was adequate. Each room had a telephone but only the double room had the fridge and television.
