The breakfast was exactly what I expected and is on a par with that offered in other European cities... the weather was so nice we were able to eat outside on their tables -- which was lovely. The staff were helpful and were always able to direct us to either a nice restaurant or wherever we were headed that day. Two women insisted on helping us up to the room with our bags despite us assuring them that we were fine and didn't need assistance. It was almost embarrassing as our bags were quite heavy and they were struggling. (Although they weren't too heavy for us.) BUT the negatives: 1) The air-conditioning didn't work. 2) Size-wise the bathroom was ok -- but the gigantic sink moved if ever you touched it and the shower was incredibly small. 3) When we arrived, the bathroom smelled disgusting and upon investigation we found our toilet had vomit caked on the outside. The inside was clean but they clearly forgot to clean the rest. We called down to the front desk and they immediately sent someone up to take care of it. The next time we were at the front desk we received an apology and the assurance that "this has never happened before." That may be the case, but it happened this time!! I was slightly disappointed with the customer service in this instance. Would I stay there again? Maybe -- but probably not. It was very good value for money as there were three in our party and our accommodation needs were quite specific. But when I go again to Venice if I only need a standard double room I'll probably try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: BigEinNC
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 great nights in their apartment a block from hotel,and it was fine. Most helpful owners/staff,friendly and knowledgable. Good location,though like all Venice hotels,tough to find at first. Would recommend with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: JudyHauger
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy June 5, 2005 and spent two night at Hotel Al Piave in Venice. A 15 minute walk from San Marco down charming streets. It was great to leave the crowds behind and wander the back streets of Venice. We could walk to all major attractions and resturants. The hotel was quiet and nicely decorated. The only negative experience we had was the A/C in our room. It did not keep the room cool enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance, my mother, and I stayed at the Al Piave in early May based on the excellent reviews Al Piave received on Tripadvisor and we were pleased with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff as well as the convenient location of the hotel. We had reserved a suite for three people, with two rooms sharing a bathroom. The suite (Rooms 212-213) was small (particularly the room with the single bed) but very clean with a beautiful marbled floor and a nice, deep sink in the bathroom (though the shower was smaller than we would have liked). Unfortunately, we encountered numerous problems with this suite, including faulty water temperature and a stopped up drain in the shower. When we reported these problems, the proprietess, Millella and her daughter, Ilalia immediately took action and tried to fix the defects. Not only did Millella and Ilalia act quickly, they also remembered to check with us to find out whether or not the issues had been resolved. Despite their best efforts, the problems persisted for a couple more days due to a malfunctioning boiler. When we expressed concern about the situation and asked if there was another room available, Ilalia immediately moved us to a family suite (112-114) in a building diagonally across the alley from the main hotel that wasn't affected by the boiler problem, and the proprietor, Paolo, took time out of his busy schedule to transport our luggages to the family suite. This family suite was very nice, with two large rooms, a spacious bathroom, and it was mosquito-free! We were very pleased with this change and grateful for Millella, Paolo and Ilalia's attentiveness and assistance. Millella, Paolo, and Ilalia are friendly and they genuinely care about the welfare of their guest, even going as far as giving us a Alilaguna (boats that run between the airport and Venice) ticket that they had not used for free. Millella and Ilalia also provided numerous recommendations on where to eat, visit, and shop, which proved to be quite helpful. Though the breakfast wasn't sumptuous, it offered delicious croissants and different tasty cured meats. The best part about breakfast was the coffee/tea/hot chocolate that were made fresh for each person and we felt quite pampered to have freshly brewed coffee in nicely polished coffee pots every morning. Despite the problems we encountered, we are very pleased with the way Al Piave's staff handled the difficulties. Al Piave's convenient location is also a huge plus. Not only is it close to San Marco's Square and the Rialto Bridge, there are other conveniences nearby, such as ATM machines, a laundromat, a fairly good restaurant right next door, and various markets where the locals shop. We were able to purchase water and snacks at decent prices to carry around with us. We hope to return in February for Carnivale and if so, we will definitely stay at Al Piave again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleaseant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: kmason5727
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late review, but this has been my first chance to advise. This was a pleasant suprise because we had just come from Paris and had a horrific hotel. We thought we might be in trouble with all the hotels we booked. But, this hotel was excellent. The service was great. We got great advice from the staff. The breakfast was plentiful. I would use this hotel again if I return. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: buffalogrover
Reviews.Content: What a lovely family-run hotel. The family members could not have been more helpful, friendly or gracious to my fiance and me. The rooms are a little on the small side but they are spotless and comfortable. We also enjoyed the location and the recommendations of Ilaria. She was so helpful and went out of her way to make our stay enjoyable!! Thank you! We will certainly stay here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “The best things do come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Travel Dates March 4-7th Having arrived at the Hotel Al Piave 2 hours prior to the required check in time, we half expected to be told to come back later as we were early(as experienced in other European Hotels). Instead we were greated by 2 friendly persons who turned out to be the owners. Having booked a double room, we were offered a choice between this or our own studio apartment. We chose the appartment, although it was very compact, it was clean, tidy, and very quiet. In short it was charming. The breakfast was great, nothing over the top but with a choice of cereal crossaints, meats,cheese, juice and coffee what more would you want. The location is superb a couple minutes from St Marks Square and Rialto bridge. One note of warning however it can be tricky to find if you go off your usual route, if you get lost as we did don't try and map read back, its much easier to head back to San Marco Vaparetto stop and follow the straight route as per the card supplied when you check in. Absolutely great value and will be recommending to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking”
Reviews.Author: benbr
Reviews.Content: At the last minute our booking in another Hotel in Venice fell through but after several hours on the internet I found Hotel Al Piave. What a jewel this turned out to be. Ideally situated for all Venice's main sights. Easy to find despite comments else where. Ilaria, Mirella and Paolo, ( and Molly the dog), who run the Hotel, can't do enough for their guests. The rooms are fine for the English, perhaps on the small side for our American cousins (but everything has to be big for them, doesn't it?) A very good continental breakfast and leisurely too...up to 10.00am There are plenty of excellent bars and restuarants in the area from moderate to the expensive. We liked Do Mori for a Tapas style stand up lunch. The Alle Madonna is an excellent Fish restaurant. Both these are just over the Rialto bridge. Another popular Trattoria is the Trattoria Alla Rivetta on Salzada s. Provolo

Reviews.Title: “Great clean room and hotel”
Reviews.Author: pechung
Reviews.Content: This is a report on Hotel Al Piave (--------) in Venice (I also did a report on Hotel Modigliani (--------) in Rome, if youâ€™re headed that way). My wife and I did a whirlwind last minute trip to Italy on Feb 19-25th 2005. First of all, everything you read about regarding the small size of the rooms and even smaller size of the room showers is absolutely correct. Hotel Al Piave is 5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and 5 minutes in a different direction to Piazza San Marco. We were very pleased with the location We took the Alilaguna from the airport to the hotel and got off at the San Marco stop, which is the last stop on the route. The Alilaguna is 10 euros per person and is very easy to use. The airport Alilaguna booth accepts credit cards but the booths in the the city do not. You can buy your roundtrip ticket at the airport, so if you want to save your euros, just buy all you Alilaguna tickets at the airport with your credit card. It takes almost exactly one hour from the airport to the San Marco stop. It leaves every 30 minutes. The first day we just walked around and got the feel for the place. The second day, we bought a one day water bus pass. It was 10.50 euros and well worth the money. Most food places will not accept credit card unless you spend a certain minimum. We mostly ate pizza and pasta. Pizza is about 5-7 euros and pasta is the same. Food is excellent. The Hotel Piave staff is awesome and most helpful. The room is nicely decorated. The only English channels on tv is CNN and BBC. My only comment to the hotel would be to add some more english speaking channels. It would have been very welcome while I was still adjusting to the time change at night. Breakfast is provided and is a nice start to the day. Same food everyday, but it tasted just fine. Overall, I would definitely return to the Hotel Al Piave. By the way, if you pay cash instead of credit card, they will reduce your hotel rate. We paid 10 euros less per night by paying in cash. We went to Rome and paid a good amount more for the hotels over there. It was nowhere near as nice as this hotel. Also, I was very pleased with how clean they kept the rooms. Nicely done to the staff of Hotel Al Piave. pechung@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel al Piave”
Reviews.Author: anitabitt
Reviews.Content: Our family of eight was in Italy for the Christmas holidays and were lucky enough to have booked rooms at Hotel al Piave. The location was wonderful, the rooms very nice and best of all the breakfast with cappuccinos were a hit with all our children. I would highly recomend the hotel for its comfort and price P. S. The family that owns and operates this charming hotel are lovely. A.Bitterlin

Reviews.Title: “Compact & Bijou”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Piave this weekend - the hotel certainly lived up to the excellent reviews we found on this website. Our room was a standard double so rather small but clean, quiet and with all necessities - lovely decoration. We had to ask at first to find the hotel as we arrived after dark but everyone is so friendly in Venice that it is was not difficult. Once you find your bearings almost everything is within 5 minutes walking distance. By far the best points are the very friendly staff and the breakfast, particularly the excellent coffee. We would certainly recommend this hotel as being excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Al Piave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Al Piave in September of 2004. It is in a great location, excellent breakfast. Highly recommend - if I return I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place, and especially good to come to after finding that the room we'd reserved at the Hotel Alycone was unacceptably dirty. We stayed in the studio down the street from the hotel, in what looked at first to be a scary dark alley but what is in fact simply a typical (and quite well-traveled, safe) Venetian street. It's also fairly convenient for getting to the airport (if you have a decent map!) - quite close to the Zaccharia vaporetto stop, where you can get an Alilaguna boat to the airport for only 10 euros. If you have trouble with stairs, do ask about the studio - it's on the ground floor, an unusual bonus in Venice. You simply walk a block to the main hotel for breakfast, which is unusually good and includes fabulous hot chocolate. The hotel is also right next to a brightly lit laundromat which is open nice and late. All in all, a fine choice in a city where good accommodations can be difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Al Piave Studio Room”
Reviews.Author: Stella975
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Studio room which was just down the street from the main hotel and along a wee alley. I did read one bad review of this room on the TripAdvisor website so wanted to add a more positive one - to give another opinion!!! We found the studio room was pretty much ideal for us. It wasn't cramped, it was really clean and had a downstairs shower room and upstairs kitchen/living area with separate double bedroom. Moreover, it was very reasonably priced (just 145 euros a night)...making it an excellent, central, base for exploring the city. The other review moans about the steps. There are about 12 and, if you are able-bodied they really are not a problem, so don't let that put you off!! All in all. it was kinda like having your own wee Venetian flat for a few days...somewhere to rest your head after a busy day - not somewhere to laze around in luxury. We'd definately go back...
